Forum Post: 
Post title: Big Blue Button Plugin - Impossible to enable the waiting room
Post description: Hello, I am having a problem with the BBB extension in Moodle management. The conference room plug-in is installed and working on the platform I use. However, even when I enable the waiting room option, so that students can only enter when authorized, they still have free access to the platform. As soon as I start a session as an administrator, they enter the room directly, without my mediation. I have already checked all the settings (I enabled students to only have access to the room as participants), but the waiting room still does not work. Would anyone know if this is due to a lack of an important update by the platform administration or if the waiting room option has actually been disabled in the latest version of the system? Has anyone else encountered this same problem? Thanks to everyone for their attention. Best regards, Egon

Forum Post: 
Post title: BBB recordings gone after switching bbb URL
Post description: Hi! We recently switched over to a new BBB infrastructure (2.7 -> 3.0) and switched out the URLs to the new Scalelite. We also synced the recordings and database entries from Scalelite, so the recordings are available. Now for some reason, after switching the URL , Recordings won't show up anymore, even after manually triggering the task check_pending_recordings. Of course we wanted to switch the URL back to the old one, so our customer can access his recordings again, but now even with the old URL the recordings won't show up anymore. What should we do now? This happened on multiple Moodle instances with Moodle 4.1. The recordings can be reached as usual with the Scalelite URL (bbb-lb. domain .com/video/<meeting-id>) We are using Scalelite v1.6.5 with Multitenancy enabled (every Moodle customer has it's own Scalelite tenant)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Deft response block adds Jitsi support
Post description: The new version of the Deft response block (1.3) has been released with a new integration with Jitsi Meet project. The block allows meeting elements to be added to a course or activity. Block content can be changed remotely and users can use real time chat and polls. They can also meet with each other using audio and video. Previously it required a remote service for updating content and audio and video. Now you can install your own Jitsi Meet server to provide that functionality instead of using the remote media server. The older servive remains available for convenience.

Forum Post: 
Post title: BigBlueButton Guest Access -
Post description: We find that logged on users have issues dealing with the BBB guest access, we wonder if other have the same experience. We have created a tracker for this issue: https://moodle.atlassian.net/browse/MDL-85873 and would be great to get some input /insights from others. the issue user experience: As a teacher I have enabled the Guest Access in my BBB activity. I shared the Guest link with my participants so they can easily access the BBB session. Some of my participantes have an account on our LMS, but are not part of the course. BUt are allowed to follow the session. When the participants is logged into Moodle LMS, and use the link. The username is automatically filled in. When they fill in the guesst password they see the notification “required” at Guest Username. Our proposed solution Modify the logicto only mark the username field as 'readonly' and 'disabled' if the user is both logged in AND has access to the course. If the user is logged in but does not have access to the course, the field should remain editable. (Please be-aware of Password managers) what we do now As a temporary workaround we added a Javascript to the addiontal HTML . The script is placed in the tracker. Looking forward to your thoughts on this. Gemma

Post title: BigBlueButton - Security Salt does not exist?
Post description: I am setting up BigBlueButton with the default free account and getting the muchtalked about "Unable to connect. Please check the url of the BigBlueButton server AND check to see if the BigBlueButton server is running" error. I was able to find the troubleshooting guide https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/error/bigbluebuttonbn/view_error_unable_join#Exceptions and am following the steps. Part 1 is fine as when I switch away from test-moodle and instead use test-install with the default secret, I am am able to launch the room just fine. For step two, the URL is fine as I am doing an exact copy/paste from the default (I tried both http and https just in case) When I get to step 3, everything goes off the rails. It seems as if the shared secret does not exist. I am given a shared secret in the setting box, but there seems to be no matching shared secret on the server itself. Running the command 'bbb-conf --secret" returns the error that bbb-conf does not exist. Following https://docs.bigbluebutton.org/dev/api.html#api-security-model I can neither retrieve nor reset the salt due to bbb-conf being not available. Accessing the server directory shows that neither bigbluebutton.properties file nor the /etc/ directory exist. (I cant remember where I read it, but I also used wget to make sure I am able to connect to the server and that was ok) Any clues as to what I may have done wrong? Why bbb-web.properties file is missing? Where could I find it? Is there any way to recreate it? 
```text
wget
```

Post title: BigBlueButton - Multi-user whiteboard erasing single-user mode text edits?
Post description: I discovered strange behaviour in the editing tools - this could be a bug in the BBB package itself. The situation (typical scenario) is: 1) Open session, start a presentation. 2) Add some text as a presenter 3) Add some other lines , triangles etc. 4) Switch on the Multi-user Whiteboard 5) In this multi-user editing mode add more text and lines. 6) Turn OFF the multi-user whiteboard => TEXT entered in the single-user mode in step 2 above gets ERASED ! Any other shapes added in Step 3 are retained OK. I wonder if anyone can confirm this, perhaps there is an explanation ... I would not like presenters to star losing their annotations when combing single-user and multi-user annotation of slides.. Regards, Przemek

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to transfer courses along with recordings sticked to them
Post description: Hello Everybody! I've got a problem and looking for suggestion how to resolve it. My history of using BBB+Moodle started in 2016. That time I've installed VM with Moodle 2.6 and VM with BBB 0.81. We used this system successfully till 2018 year, that time we decided to upgrade Moodle to brand new 3.6.1 and BBB to 2.0 beta. I established new VM, got fresh installation for BBB and I copied all recordings from 0.81 to 2.0. Then I switched off old 0.81 BBB and tested communication of Moodle 2.6 with new BBB server 2.0 and everything worked fine. That time we decided to save time and let both Moodle (old one 2.6 and new one 3.6.1) worked with one instance of BBB 2.0. I was going to move my courses alog with recordings of the old Moodle instance 2.6 to the new one 3.6.1 later and I supposed it should be easy for me, but I mistaken... So I adjusted my firewall and two different Moodle web-sites worked on different ports fine. Untill I decided to upgrade BBB to the latest 2.2 release. The reason was Adobe Flash EOL and I wanted new technologies like HTML5 client, using it on mobile phones and all the new features which appeared in BBB since my last upgrade. I did that upgrade the same way as before - just made fresh installation using BBB-conf script and copied all my folders with recordings to the new VM. Then I set up new Internet connection, because BBB required wide broadband channel, and I changed IP, readjust everything, domain name, firewall and so on. Finally I tested it with new Moodle instance - everything worked fine! I was glad till the moment I tested old Moodle instance 2.6 - it was unsuccessful. Of course I changed secret key (aka SALT), but I din't know should I change URL (I left it the same, because I didn't change domain name, only adjusted new IP in DNS records). Summarizing all up-mentioned my question is: "Does somebody know the way to transfer courses as well as lists of BBB recordings which belong to them from old 2.6 Moodle instance to new 3.6.1" I've tried it today and it transfered with empty list of recordings, only other kind of standard Moodle plugins and other content... The problem is that old 2.6 Moodle also lost all recording lists... I am in despair! Please suggest any workable way to resurrect my webinars! Thanks in advance!

Forum Post: 
Post title: BigBlueButton: Old Recordings Suddenly Disappeared, New Recordings Never Appear
Post description: Hi, I have been running BBB successfully on my Moodle site for over a year, possibly longer; I have been using http://test-install.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/ . It has been a terrific plugin, and really helpful for me, and for my students. Last week my server 's hard drive failed, and I had to restore from the recent backup that I fortunately had. Since then, all of my previous recordings have vanished, meaning that the entry for the every one of my previous recordings (about 30 of them) says "There are no recording for this meeting." More than that, new recordings that I (thought) I made are producing the same message. The lecture streams just fine, I have online students who see it just fine in realtime, but the lecture is not being recorded. And yes, I did have the "Session can be recorded" checkbox checked (that is my default setting for the BBB plugin). I am also aware that the recordings go away after 14 days; however, unless my memory is failing me, I recall that the link to the recording is still visible in the BBB activity; it produces the "this recording is not available" only when that link is clicked. For me now, all of those links are gone. I have been testing it tonight, and no recordings are happening. The only error message I have found is in the Chrome developer's console, which said that the html5 server returned a 404 (not found) error. I see nothing in my server's logfiles (I refer to the server files, not the moodle logfiles, or the BBB/RBN logfiles; I don't know where those logfiles are located.) My version of BBB is 2.1.1 (2016051905), RecordingsBN is 1.3.0 (2016051904), Moodle 3.1.2 (build 20161027). My server is OSX Lion, running (among other things) MySQL v5.6.33 and PHP v5.6.27. It's worth saying, maybe, that the hard drive crash/restore may not be relevant; it may only be co-incidental. Can you suggest an approach I can take to diagnose this issue, and hopefully fix it? While it would be great to get my recordings back (the last 14 days, anyway), more important to me is to be able to make new recordings going forward. Thanks in advance! Cheers, Kevin

Post title: Looking for bigger Big Blue Button users
Post description: Dear all, We are running a Moodle site with 10 000+ users and a virtual classroom installation with up to 500 simultaneous users. We are looking for an alternative virtual classroom that can support this number of simultaneous users (divided over a dozen concurrent  sessions or more). We have been looking at BBB now and again and recently it has started to include the functionality we need (recording, breakout rooms, etc.), so now I wonder if there are any users of BBB out there who have installations of similar or bigger size, so that I can ask them about the hardware infrastructure we would require to set up a server that is sufficiently powerful for our needs. I also have a number of questions about possible functionality (to which I have not yet been able to find the answers on-line): Can one BBB server serve virtual classrooms to two Moodle sites if they are in the same Moodle server? Does the Moodle integration limit BBB sessions to accept only users authenticated via Moodle, or is it also possible to have people from outside of Moodle access the session (acccess via a link)? Will the number of Breakout rooms be flexible (5 seems to few for our class sizes)? Thanks in advance for any information you can share. Rgrds, Paul.

Post title: Adobe Connect plugin for Moodle 2.7 HTTP Authentication Header
Post description: Hello, I'm working with a client on Moodle 2.7.3+.  I installed the Adobe Connect version for Moodle 2.7 and they are having some challenges getting it to work and it might be related to the settings. The problem seems to be with the  HTTP Authentication header. It appears that their Adobe rep has suggested they leave this field blank, but the test connection fails and when trying to add it as an activity, the whole site just hangs forever. This is what they sent to me: HTTP Authentication Header - This value can be found in your custom.ini file for your Adobe Connect Pro server . In the custom.ini file look for the line that begins with HTTP_AUTH_HEADER, enter in the value after the equal sign. Example if your custom.ini file has the line HTTP_AUTH_HEADER=rl-user-id, then only use rl-user-id in the module global setting. leave it blank Does anyone out there have any advice? Thanks! Erin

Forum Post: 
Post title: Web Conferencing for Free or Almost Free...
Post description: I have a small group of students that I conference with so I don't want to pay some host $50 per month.  I find that Adobe Connect, BBB, Elluminate, and OpenMeetings only make sense if you have an expensive server and large bandwidth.  What if you are just meeting with a few students? Join.Me - https://join.me/ - Free - Supported by LogMeIn company.  You install a very small exe on your machine and I've have broadcasted my desktop up to 20 people at the same time. You can allow any of them to control your desktop, it's super easy to chat and send files. Pros: Free Broadcasts desktop up to 20 people with high quality. Can transfer files between host and participants. Participants don't need to install ANY software. Cons: No VOIP - you'll need Skype or something else. No Webcam support Need to install a small piece of software to start. They just need a flash enabled browser. Can't "trade" desktop views. Yvew http://vyew.com/s/ - Shares a whiteboard with everyone. Free up to 10 participantss.  Yvew even has a table explaining why Yvew is better than Adobe Connect and WebEx. ( http://vyew.com/site/product/comparison ) Pros: Free (Up to 10 people) Saves your sessions so that people can go back and review. People can easily share pictures, documents, videos. Can make breakout rooms and subchat rooms. Webcam and Audio Support Many Administrator features.. you can give people moderator access if you want. Can share desktops (not tested) Cons: All clients need a flash browser. Video quality of webcam poor compared to Skype. Audio is not as good as well.

Post description: We are pleased to announce the availability of a release candidate (RC) for BigBlueButton 0.81 , our eleventh release to date. A release candidate for BigBlueButton means all development is finished, all testing is done, and the only remaining task is to change the label from 0.81-RC to 0.81. Our goal for each release of BigBlueButton is to advance the project in stability, usability , and core features.  A release candidate is the final stage of our development process. Want to give a BIG THANKS to everyone who used an earlier version of 0.81, given us feedback, submitted a bug request, sent us a pull request, or posted or tweeted about our project. Forum Post: 
Post title: Connect-to-Moodle
Post description: Hi Folks, I'm up-to-date with the discussion about the Remote Learner Adobe Connect plugin for moodle here: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=145225 , particularly in regard to the inability to connect to a hosted adobe solution with SSO. I've just noticed on the adobe site another plugin for use with adobe connect and moodle: http://www.adobe.com/uk/products/adobeconnect/feature-details/connect-moodle.html Does anyone have any experience with this mod? http://www.refineddata.com/learning-management/c2m I can't see any reviews for it, or any mentions of it in moodle.org forums. What is of interest is the money-line: Connect-to-Moodle provides a Single Sign On (SSO) environment in which information passes effortlessly in both directions between the two platforms so users cannot tell where Moodle ends and Adobe Connect begins. The SSO associated with the free integrator doesn't work with Adobe Hosted Solutions (majority of Adobe deployments). I wonder how they have achieved this with: " Connect-to-Moodle is installed as a series of simple drop-in modules, blocks and activities . ", when the discussion on the remote leaner plugin points to adobe being the problem for SSO on hosted solutions? Has anyone had any experience with this mod? Would anyone from Remote Learner like to comment? Cheers, -David

Forum Post: 
Post title: BBB - Multiple meetings / scheduled mettings
Post description: I have a client who uses continuous enrolment and needs to run meetings as a "days after enrolment" type schedule. They have worked out a complex system of dates for when different levels of enrolment would be available for the next virtual meeting. Think of it like this: Day 1 : User 1,2 & 3 enrol Day 25: User 4 & 5 enrol Day 30 : Users 1, 2 & 3 do their first scheduled meeting over BBB, share files, do video conferences, that stuff. (Not recorded or assessed) Day 45: More users enrol Day 55 : Users 4 & 5 do their first scheduled meeting Day 60 : Users 1, 2 & 3 have their second scheduled meeting, which is recorded and assessed. etc ... We don't know the calendar dates of "day N", except by counting them out. Days after enrolment type scheduling is a pain, but that's the job. Our second problem is that BBB seems to have a "single activity = single meeting" association. So over time, the course is going to have a stack of use-once-then-discard activities , which is something I'd like to avoid. I'd like to know if there's a way to modify the plugin for moodle (or if there is an existing plugin) that allows multiple schedules for a single activity.

Post title: BBB Attendance Report in Moodle
Post description: Reporting "attendance" is one of the selection requirements for a webconferencing software. How is the specific Moodle-initiated BBB session identified to the BBB server ? Is is accessed via a get URL ? If so, to get the start and end time of a participant, two details could be added to that URL : an "entry url" and an "exit url". When the BBB server does a successful get on the entry url, it sends "time of entry" to the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_log table. When the user exits the session (e.g., via logging out or losing the connection for whatever reason) the BBB server does a get on the exit url and sends the "time of exit" to the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_log table. Does that make sense?

Forum Post: 
Post title: BigBlueButtonBN activity module 1.0.8-b2 just released
Post description: I want to announce that as part of the efforts for having a really solid integration of BigBlueButton with Moodle we have just released a new version of the BigBlueButtonBN and RecordingBN modules. This is the 1.0.8-b2 release that has been labeled as version 2012081300 for both components, BigBlueButtonBN and RecordingsBN . The main changes and/or improvements included since the previos release are: 1. The schedule parameters that were originaly activated only for activities in section 1 and higher, are now also available for activities in the section 0. 2. There was a serious security issue on internal calls to index.php, ajax .php and bbb-broker. The access was not validated according to the permissions of the users. This issue was registered as CONTRIB-3840 on the Moodle tracking system. 3. A bug was preventing the normal operation of the module on servers accessing bigbluebutton and external services trhought a proxy server . This bug was registered as CONTRIB-3844 on the Moodle tracking system. These are the issues reported by users during the beta one testing phase. If you find anything that you think is a bug or it can be improved, please don't hesitate in letting us know or directly create an issue on the tracking system for the corresponding project ( BigBlueButtonBN or RecordingsBN )

Forum Post: 
Post title: OpenMeetings Moodle Mod Version 1.2 and security update with OpenMeetings 1.8.3
Post description: With the new integration and OpenMeetings version 1.8.3 you can now create separated users in OpenMeetings with the access-level "SOAP-Only". The "SOAP-Only" user can do exactly what is needed to run the integration but nothing more. This does result in no need for any OpenMeetings Admin-User in the Moodle Module config! So you can better protect your OpenMeetings server from non-authorized access via the SOAP Gateway and no need to share confidential account data."SOAP-Only" users can not login to OpenMeetings administration or manipulate user accounts via SOAP. It is recommended to update to the latest version of OpenMeetings (1.8.3). Moodle Mod 0.9 for Moodle 1.9.x is still compatible with OpenMeetings 1.8.3 and you can also use the new secure user with access level "SOAP-Only" with the old Moodle Mod 0.9. Sample Video showing the installation of Moodle Mod and integration with new access level: New features of Moodle Plugin : - Secure "SOAP-Only" user access level (see documentation on top) - 3 Moderation Types for Conference Rooms (Moodle admins, teachers and course creators are automatically a moderator): Moderation Type A) Participants need to wait till the teacher enters the room Moderation Type B) Participants can already start (first User in room becomes moderator) Moderation Type C) Every participant is automatically moderator when he/she enters the room - New Flag "Allow Recording": You can set in the room configuration now a flag that controls if the recording button is available or not You can try and test the Moodle integration at: http://moodle.openmeetings.de Download is available from our project side: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/ Support is available at: http://www.openmeetings.de Sebastian

Post title: Web Conference with Sychronous video
Post description: Hi to all! It seems that after numerous testing projects I will finally try Moodle for real!!! (extremely small scale but still in a "production" environment). The problem is that, apart from asynchronous training, we need to implement some basic web conferencing with (and here is the catch) synchronous video streaming. To illustrate, imagine this scenario: A web conference with 1 instructor and 5 to 10 max participants where the instructor has the ability to present a video (and also pause, rewind etc) which the participants can see in real time over internet (not LAN) in adequate quality and all sides should be able to voice comment on it. Of course, all the web conferencing goodies that, for example, bigbluebutton offers (like whiteboard, raise hands etc.) are more than welcome but not essential. Sharing a Desktop while the video is playing doesn't seem to do the trick since the quality would propably be inadequate. I know I am asking a lot (especially if you consider that it should be a free or low-cost solution at least at the beginning of the project) but I was hoping that someone could suggest a solution or workaround. Thanks in advance, Andreas

Forum Post: 
Post title: OpenMeetings Moodle Mod 1.1 and OpenMeetings 1.7
Post description: We are happy to announce Version 1.1 of the Moodle Mod for OpenMeetings. It fixes that updates to the conference room in Moodle are correctly populated to OpenMeetings. OpenMeetings recently was also updated to Version 1.7 with a number of updates: Multi-Whiteboard, you can add new whiteboard instances, each whiteboard can have the full range of tools and documents inside. Advanced File-Explorer, Drag and Drop Interface for managing files, including possibility to create a document tree with folders. Private and Public Drive in File-Explorer. The File-Explorer has two different views, one is the Private Drive and the other the Public Drive . The Private Drive always contains the same files. Those files are only visible to the user currently loggedin. The Public Drive is bound not to the user, but to the conference room. All users in the conference room have access to the Public Drive. Save whiteboards. You can save each whiteboard instance as a file. The file is located in the File-Explorer and can be drag and drop'ed and organized like any other document, image or folder. New User-Level: SOAP/Web-Service only. For security reasons there is a new user-level. You can now create user-accounts that have only the ability to access via SOAP. In former versions you always need an admin account. MyRooms section. Each user has now by default 2 personal rooms that are always accessible exclusive for that user. There are buttons to enter those rooms from the dashboard VoIP-Integration. Together with our Finish partner and the Open Source Department of Kvarken region we have done a VoIP integration by using an applet for the audio part. For further information see VoIPAndSIP And we've updated out website at: http://www.openmeetings.de Sebastian

Post title: BigBlueButton - problems with modules
Post description: Hello , my name is Sebastian , I am Argentinian and this is my first post . I have installed Moodle and BigBlueButton on different servers ( Windows and Ubuntu) . Both work correctly separately . I installed Moodle modules to connect to BBB , i have tested with Dual Code and the Blindside Networks module and both i found the same problem: the students never have access to the conference if it is configured to have to wait for connecting the moderator . With the Dual Code module is configuration is preset and can not change , so students should always wait for it to connect the moderator . They can never connect, the module does not detect that the moderator already connected . With Blindside Networks module configuration can be changed , so the moderator and students can connect only if the settings indicate that " students m ust n ot w ait until a moderator joins ". Also, with this module from M oodle I can not see how many students have joined the conference and I can not end the same for all ( if you disconnect the facilitator , students can remain connected ) . So, in summary , with the two modules I have the same problem , the difference is that the module Blindside Networks can be configured to help in exchange for significant loss of functionality. I hope someone can help me please . Thank you very much and sorry for my bad English

Post title: Elluminate Live Module for Moodle 2.0
Post description: Hi, I'm wondering if anybody else that has EL module integrated in their Moodle site has encountered a similar issue when upgrading to Moodle 2.0. We did a test upgrade from M1.9.10 to 2.0.2. We have Elluminate Live module installed in our 1.9, and I was aware that the latest version posted here: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=557&filter=1 is for 1.9, but I just thought to give it a try and drop it in the upgraded Moodle 2.0, and indeed was unsuccessful. I then found out on Elluminate's website that they have a bridge package that supports Moodle 2.0 and is available from their download page . So I got the package and was about to install it, but on the new block/ mod confirmation page I noticed that it's called 'elluminate' now, not 'elluminatelive', thus moodle will treat it as a new install instead of an upgrade. I looked at some of the upgrade  and install scripts in the package, and I think all my data in "mdl_elluminatelive_xxxxxxx" tables will not be transferred, which means that currently scheduled meetings will no longer be there and links to the recordings won't appear on the block. So is there any solution/ workaround/ hint to tackle this. Is the Elluminate Live Module posted in the plugin download page still being supported/ further developed to some extent? thank you, Dimas

Post title: Stream Connect Module
Post description: Hi All We've just completed a new module for adding a series of webcasts to your moodle. This resource is an embedded iframe for a webcast.  The webcast is chosen by the course creator from a list found on an RSS feed.  The location of the RSS feed is global to the site and is set by administrator. CVS = http://cvs.moodle.org/contrib/plugins/blocks/streamconnectsettings/ CVS = http://cvs.moodle.org/contrib/plugins/mod/resource/type/streamconnect/ Bugs = http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB/component/10881 Download = http://cvs.moodle.org/contrib/plugins/blocks/streamconnectsettings.zip Download = http://cvs.moodle.org/contrib/plugins/mod/resource/type/streamconnect.zip You do need an account with Stream Connect to use the plugin  - sales@streamuk.com or 0800 061 2361 This was built by Stream UK in conjunction with Synergy Learning. Best Duncan

Forum Post: 
Post title: OpenMeetings 1.4 and Moodle Plugin Version 0.9
Post description: Hi, we are happy to announce Version 0.9 of the Moodle Plugin and Version 1.4 of OpenMeetings. Version 0.9 of the Moodle Plugin contains a patch to fix the problem with utf8 characters in moodle usernames (which where displayed wrong in OpenMeetings). OpenMeetings 1.4 adds some new features too: New Features: Remote Desktop Control (RDC) in Screen Sharing and separated right for RDC in user list, Moderators are able by default to do RDC other users can apply for it using the right-buttons New separated right for allowing Screen Sharing and Recording Multi- Domain Support: Separated Admin interface for configuring multiple LDAP configurations with a single OpenMeetings Instance, in the Login Box you are able to choose different domains now, each domain represents a LDAP config (you can still use the internal DB all the time, the internal DB is always in the list) New Room features: Close and open conference rooms. Additionally with a redirect- URL in case the room is closed and SOAP Methods to remotely open and close room. Moderators can also close a room from inside the conference room (Menubar: Actions > Close room). Users which are already loggedin will then be redirected to the redirect URL Fix missing attributes in Backup file and add Meeting-Members New Language: Danish, thx to ALO, update Spanish thx to Jesmargo Various small Bugfixes The complete changelog can be found at: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/wiki/ChangeLog Downloads can be retrieved from the project website: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/

Post title: DImDIm 5.5 Beta Test
Post description: The current beta code for testing the DimDim 5.5 plugin can be found here: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-2157 If you want to test: Set up a tracker login Log in to the tracker "Watch" the issue Post the results of your testing to the item NOTE that this is not production code and that prior beta versions have resulted in possible corruption of dbs. Forum Post: 
Post title: Elluminate Live! integration updated to support server 9.5 / manager 3.0
Post description: Thanks to help from Tanveer Virani at Elluminate, I was able to update the Moodle integration with new code to support the latest release of Elluminate . The code for Moodle version 1.9 was updated and you can download the latest code from the usual place: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=557&filter=1 There are updated installation instructions in the wiki for a brand new 9.5/3.0 install or if you have upgraded from an older version of Elluminate which already had the custom Moodle adapter installed as well. Those specific instructions can be found in the MoodleDocs wiki here: Deployment instructions of the new Moodle adapter (ELM 3.0) NOTE: If you are not using the latest version of Elluminate, the latest Moodle code will continue to work for you. The changes made are backwards-compatible with previous Elluminate versions.

Post title: Elluminate 9.0 compatibility?
Post description: Has anyone installed the Elluminate 9.0 update yet? Are there any known compatibility issues with the Moodle integration module? The reason why I'm asking is that we host our own Moodle (1.9) and Elluminate servers. I upgraded Elluminate from 8.5 to 9.0 per their directions, which were for a standalone system. I made no changes at all to the Moodle side. Since the upgrade, there have been reports of strange things when using Elluminate through Moodle. Today, I have a report that a faculty member received a pink Moodle error box saying "You must be a moderator to create meetings" when he/she tried to add another Elluminate meeting to a Moodle course. Forum Post: 
Post title: Deft response block adds Jitsi support
Post description: The new version of the Deft response block (1.3) has been released with a new integration with Jitsi Meet project. The block allows meeting elements to be added to a course or activity. Block content can be changed remotely and users can use real time chat and polls. They can also meet with each other using audio and video. Previously it required a remote service for updating content and audio and video. Now you can install your own Jitsi Meet server to provide that functionality instead of using the remote media server. The older servive remains available for convenience.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Daniel The documentation says, "If you wish to use Jitsi Meet, you need to install and configure a Jitsi Meet server locally." Does it mean, we can't connect it to a third party Jitsi server?
Comment 2: It should work with external hosting as long as it is set up of token based authentication and you have an app ID and secret for the Moodle instance. You can use the same App id and secret with the Jitsi activity if you are using that (or Plenary meeting ).

Post title: BigBlueButton Guest Access -
Post description: We find that logged on users have issues dealing with the BBB guest access, we wonder if other have the same experience. We have created a tracker for this issue: https://moodle.atlassian.net/browse/MDL-85873 and would be great to get some input /insights from others. the issue user experience: As a teacher I have enabled the Guest Access in my BBB activity. I shared the Guest link with my participants so they can easily access the BBB session. Some of my participantes have an account on our LMS, but are not part of the course. BUt are allowed to follow the session. When the participants is logged into Moodle LMS, and use the link. The username is automatically filled in. When they fill in the guesst password they see the notification “required” at Guest Username. Our proposed solution Modify the logicto only mark the username field as 'readonly' and 'disabled' if the user is both logged in AND has access to the course. If the user is logged in but does not have access to the course, the field should remain editable. (Please be-aware of Password managers) what we do now As a temporary workaround we added a Javascript to the addiontal HTML . The script is placed in the tracker. Looking forward to your thoughts on this. Gemma

Forum Post: 
Post title: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
Post description: Looking to have a discussion around pros and cons of continuing to use the plugin vs moving to LTI integration. The plugin looks to be still well supported. Anyone have any thoughts on this? Plugin vs LTI
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: As the current plugin developer, we are maintaining it because it gives additional benefits beyond what the LTI can offer by more closely integrating with Moodle's core functionality. Whether you are pre-assigning breakout rooms using Moodle groups, automatically collecting participation reports, auto-linking to Zoom recordings, or scheduling Webinars instead of Meetings, we include functionality that real people need and not just what Zoom has decided to offer. Plus, if there's functionality that you need, you are in control of your destiny. A lot of organizations will suggest functionality and sometimes provide the code to accomplish it. Those conversation's happen on our GitHub repository.
Comment 2: Hi Jonathan, is there anywhere I can find out more about the grading and attendance reporting of Zoom sessions within a course? I'm trying to advise on which way to integrate with Zoom, but it's hard to find information on the detailed functioning of either option. many thanks in advance
Comment 3: Hi Isabel, Sorry for the delay - we currently have two options for grading and attendance reporting. However, due to limitations in Zoom itself, any method has some level of inaccuracy. For a detailed discussion of the development process for the newer duration-based grading: https://github.com/ncstate-delta/moodle-mod_zoom/pull/477 In summary, one method is "attendance grading", so that when the student clicks to join the meeting from Moodle they get full credit for attending the meeting. The newer duration-based method gives percentage credit based on the duration of attendance. The newer method is complicated, because it relies heavily on the data that is available in Zoom and matching up the attendee information with the Moodle user information is not always exact, so manual editing may be needed in varying amounts depending on how the Zoom meetings and the Zoom plugin activities are configured. Here is the grading method help text: Choose the method to use when grading student participation. Upon entry: the student receives full marks (max grade) when they click to join the meeting in Moodle. Attendance duration: the student receives a score based on the percentage of their meeting attendance compared to the total meeting duration. Notes regarding Attendance duration method:
Comment 4: Hi Susan, I've been searching for this exact question, so I was wondering how you got on? Did you implement one or the other?
Comment 5: Hi Isabel, We have been successfully using the Zoom plug-in for a few years now and are happy with it. We are currently on moodle v4.1.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Cannot delete Moodle courses with no longer existing BBB activity
Post description: Dear Community, We have used Big Blue Button a few years ago and it was used in some Moodle courses. Now the BBB server no longer exists. I get the following error message when I try to delete the Moodle course: Error: Argument 1 passed to mod_bigbluebuttonbn\instance::__construct() must be an instance of cm_info, null given, called in [ dirroot ]/mod/bigbluebuttonbn/classes/instance.php on line 139 Deleting the Moodle course is not possible. Does anyone have a solution for the problem? thanks & best regards Anton
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Community, I think I have found a solution. Perhaps it will also work for others: I think that the BBB plugin accesses the BBB server when deleting the courses in order to delete the recording there as well. Our old server data is still stored in the Moodle backend (bigbluebuttonbn_server_url), but the server no longer exists. In my opinion, this causes the error message in Moodle and the course can therefore not be deleted. Our solution is as follows: we still have a server URL and the token of an old BBB test instance that is still running. We have entered this URL and token in the backend. Now the courses can also be deleted - even if the recordings do not exist on this test server. At least it works for us. best regards, Anton

Forum Post: 
Post title: recurring bbb meeting
Post description: how can i make the bbb meeting repeated every week
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi ahmed alwa, BBB meetings work more like rooms which are open until the teacher schedules them to be closed than instances that repeat at set times. So to answer your question, there is no straightforward way to do it. There are workarounds that might work for you, depending on what you want to accomplish e.g. one BBB activity that has an open and closing time that is edited every week
Comment 2: An idea, works only if the teacher has an account on the BBB server , not going through the Moodle BBB plug-in . - Visit bbbserver/rooms and reate a new "room" on the BBB server and start it. You'll get a link like bbbserver/rooms/xxx-xxx-xx-xxx/join and an access code. - On Moodle create a URL resource for that link. You can put the access code in its description. - Use the availability options Moodle offers to limit the access to what you want. Of course if you give the access code in the description, the student can go there any time - and meet others! You have to judge whether that is OK with your audience. Otherwise, there must be ways of rotating the access code, etc.

Post title: BigBlueButton: Moderator/Presenter audio choppy during webinar
Post description: I have a tutor who is experiencing issues when running webinars via BBB. Their audio dips in and out during sessions. They have been using Edge (I have suggested using Chrome), their downstream is 51.39 and upstream is 7.62. The tutor has even tethered to the office ethernet cable, but is still having the same problem. Can anyone offer any suggestions on what the problems could be? They are able to use other systems such as Zoom without audio issues. I will be advising to turn off their camera when presenting (as they will be using audio + presentation). Is there anything else that may help?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: These are not Moodle problems, but BigBlueButton provider problems. You should contact your BBB provider or if you simply "Don't known who is"  probably you've not configured anything else than the "free server " preconfigured in Moodle 4.x, but the preconfigured one it's only a test server with limitations. If you plan to use BBB, you should subscribe a service (the fast and secure way) or install BBB by yourself on premise (the hard way). ...Zoom it's not a "no pay" choice, why BBB should ? WebConferencing systems consume power/network that has to be payed.

Forum Post: 
Post title: BigBlueButton - Security Salt does not exist?
Post description: I am setting up BigBlueButton with the default free account and getting the muchtalked about "Unable to connect. Please check the url of the BigBlueButton server AND check to see if the BigBlueButton server is running" error. I was able to find the troubleshooting guide https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/error/bigbluebuttonbn/view_error_unable_join#Exceptions and am following the steps. Part 1 is fine as when I switch away from test-moodle and instead use test-install with the default secret, I am am able to launch the room just fine. For step two, the URL is fine as I am doing an exact copy/paste from the default (I tried both http and https just in case) When I get to step 3, everything goes off the rails. It seems as if the shared secret does not exist. I am given a shared secret in the setting box, but there seems to be no matching shared secret on the server itself. Running the command 'bbb-conf --secret" returns the error that bbb-conf does not exist. Following https://docs.bigbluebutton.org/dev/api.html#api-security-model I can neither retrieve nor reset the salt due to bbb-conf being not available. Accessing the server directory shows that neither bigbluebutton.properties file nor the /etc/ directory exist. (I cant remember where I read it, but I also used wget to make sure I am able to connect to the server and that was ok) Any clues as to what I may have done wrong? Why bbb-web.properties file is missing? Where could I find it? Is there any way to recreate it? 
```text
wget
```
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: That last part got cut off … As I was saying, the bottom of that guide does mention I should run wget to verify that my server can connect to the big blue button server. I run wget and the return coded does send back "Success".
Comment 2: Hi Jack, Are you running your own BBB server and did your own installation? I assume so as you can access the BBB server to run the mentioned command. On Ubuntu and depending on user permission setup, you could try running bbb-conf as root user or use "sudo bbb-conf --secret" And then if it's your own installation you'd need to insert your own BBB's URL at whichever domain you host it at. Happy to help more if you're still stuck. I'd need some info as to what BBB version you installed, which OS version etc. Thanks
Comment 3: Im sorry for the one month delay. Major things happened in my life including moving to another country. Anyway, I am not running my own BBB server. I am using the 'free tier' service from blindside networks that comes as a default included with Moodle. Since I am only using moodle for 1-on-1 tutoring (and sometimes demoing it for schools) this is fine for my needs. Part of my confusion was from trying to run the commands on my web-host and not understanding that the BBB server was on blindside networks and not my own web server. Since I last posted, I tried out various short term trials of hosting companies, including biggerbluebutton and higheredlab and both are able to launch a room totaly fine. And as I said before, running blindside networks 'test' server also works fine. It very much seems as if blindside networks has discontinued their 'free tier' services but never anounced it. Everything I read still seems to indicate that using the defaults for Moodle 4.0 and BBB would still let me conect to the blindside networks free service, but in practice I simply cant conect.
Comment 4: Hi Jack, no I tested the free service some seconds ago and it works fine. You cannot browser the BBB default URL, which is https://test-moodle.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/ . And you should use the "standard" secret which can be read in the code here: https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/master/mod/bigbluebuttonbn/classes/local/config.php
Comment 5: Hi Jack, Blindside Networks still offers a free service, it has not been discontinued. Based on your comments, it sounds like you are using Moodle 4.0, so if you are not hosting your own BBB server but trying to use the default one included with Moodle, try using the credentials Sergio mentioned in the above comment. To change the server credentials used within Moodle, you have to do it from the BBB plugin General Settings section. Once you do that, are you still getting the error?
Comment 6: Everything is working fine now. Using the 'standard' secret fixed it. I am somewhat confused about how the default instillation generated an unusable standard secret, but as soon as I changed it to the standard secret from the codebase, it started working. Thank you everyone!

Post title: BigBlueButton - Multi-user whiteboard erasing single-user mode text edits?
Post description: I discovered strange behaviour in the editing tools - this could be a bug in the BBB package itself. The situation (typical scenario) is: 1) Open session, start a presentation. 2) Add some text as a presenter 3) Add some other lines , triangles etc. 4) Switch on the Multi-user Whiteboard 5) In this multi-user editing mode add more text and lines. 6) Turn OFF the multi-user whiteboard => TEXT entered in the single-user mode in step 2 above gets ERASED ! Any other shapes added in Step 3 are retained OK. I wonder if anyone can confirm this, perhaps there is an explanation ... I would not like presenters to star losing their annotations when combing single-user and multi-user annotation of slides.. Regards, Przemek
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Przemek Kaszubski, This is a BBB bug. A ticket has already been opened for it ( You can find it here: https://github.com/bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton/issues/15458 )
Comment 2: Thanks ! I hope the suggested fix at https://github.com/bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton/pull/15500 will work and be integrated soon.
Comment 3: Cf. https://github.com/bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton/pull/15500#issuecomment-1224677161 : "This fix will be part of the next 2.5 release (2.5.5)"

Post description: Hello, I have BBB 2.3 integrated and running with Moodle 3.9 on the server which is running fine. I have just enabled Mobile app functionality on Moodle and installed Moodle app on my Android phone. I am able to login to the Moodle Mobile app. While going to the My course and try to launch the course, I receive the message that " The conference has been ended". Do I need to make any change and need additional configuration to run BBB from Moodle Mobile app ? I need this for both Android and IOS. Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Brain, The UI offered for the mobile app is a simplified view of the room. It does not include recordings. For the inability to join a meeting. Have you tried a newer version of the plugin?, 2.3 is no longer supported. It would only receive critical security patches. 2.4.x is the one that is still supported. Jesus
Comment 2: I am already using latest plugin version 2.4.5. Any way to have recordings to be available on mobile app ?
Comment 3: Hi Brain, unfortunately there's no way to get recordings on the mobile app, recordings are only available in the web browser. In BBB v2.4.5 are you still encountering an issue when you join a meeting? If so, could you detail how you're going about it?
Comment 4: Hello, I created a new test course and now able to see in the Moodle mobile app. Need to look into what happened to old course.

Post title: BigBlueButton - Sudden Classroom Errors - Unable to Connect to BigBlueButton Server
Post description: Hi All, I'm at my witts end here! After 18 months of successful running all of a sudden, 3 instances that I manage encountered the same error. All instances of Moodle are version 3.9 and BBB version 2.2. We suddenly received an error when trying to access the classroom link and/or recorded sessions. It stated "Unable to connect to the BigBlueButton Server ." I double checked the URL and secret in the plugin settings and they were all correct. A restart of both the moodle and BBB servers allowed us to start a session again, but now it will not load a presentation. It just won't show any slides and gives an error in the BBB logs about failed to upload presentation 404 error. I'm unsure if this is a moodle/BBB plugin error or a BBB server error, but any pointers would be greatly received as I've now spent 6 hours trying to solve and need to get this up and running before lessons resume tomorrow. Many Thanks Greg
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Are you using Let's Encrypt Certificates on BBB ? Take care of this if apply: https://twitter.com/letsencrypt/status/1443621997288767491
Comment 2: Hi Unfortunately, I also found this problem on September 30, and it seems to be related to the expiration of Let's Encrypt's certificates, and I did not find a solution for it because my web server is Windows. This is the only problem with Moodle's LMS and other systems such as WordPress do not have a problem
Comment 3: Hi, had the same problem on a Windows system. Solution: replace cacert.pem in moodle/lib with an updated version. Best, Frank

Forum Post: 
Post title: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
Post description: Hi Everyone, Any help much appreciated. I am trying to connect my Moodle to my own BigBlueButton server . It worked for a day but now whenever I add an instance of BigBlueButton to the moodle I get the error Exception - Class 'plugin' not found - with a 404 error thrown on https://example.com/course/modedit.php?add=bigbluebuttonbn&type=&course=167&section=0&return=0&sr=0 I can connect to the demo server from Moodle using the default settings. I can connect to my own bigblueserver from another moodle running on localhost using the secret / salt from bbb-conf. If I run WGET from inside my Moodle container with the URL of my BBB server it return the SUCCESS code - <response> <returncode>SUCCESS</returncode> <version>2.0</version> My setup Big Blue Button: Version 2.4-rc-1 Moodle: Moodle 3.11.3+ (Build: 20211003) running in a docker container behind a proxy server. Moodle Big Blue Plugin: 2019101011 Any ideas how I could further troubleshoot the problem Thanks again
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I have the same problem but I can't find any solution for it yet.
Comment 2: Can you share some more details of your system and then we can work out what is causing it. Thanks.
Comment 3: Every thing was ok until 5 days ago. Suddenly the bigbluebuttonbn plugins stop working and we received an error that the moodle can not communicate with bigbluebutton server(Unable to join the meeting. Please check the url of the BigBlueButton server AND check to see if the BigBlueButton server is running.) while our other moodle site is working properly with the same bigbluebutton. We remove the plugins & install the last version so we receive the above error.(Exception - Class 'plugin' not found) Again we downgrade it to previous version again we couldn't access to our server.We change the Moodle server location & migrate it to other server but nothing change. we Upgrade the moodle to 3.11 the same problem exist. everything works properly separately but together there is this problem
Comment 4: Ok so that was the same day that mine went down. So I'm guessing it's something to do with the Sept / Oct change. Maybe an expired SSL certificate. I've no idea to be honest. How are you managing SSL?
Comment 5: In Sept, 30 there was the Let's Encrypt CA expiration: search on google and you'll find many hints about this problem. Anyway, the exception it's not related to this, but it seems that you have one of these situations: PHP version not adequate to the moodle release you're using (most probable) BBB plugin version for a different moodle release or a development one (less probable) Check them with the official documentation for the moodle release last installed.
Comment 6: Hi - thanks a lot for the response. The PHP version is fine - I'm running 7.3.0 with Moodle 3.11.3+ I also have the correct BBB plugin version Also the plugin was working fine before October 1st so I don't think the PHP version can be the problem. Can you think of any reason the Let's Encrypt CA expiration could have an effect. I can reach my BBB server OK from the Moodle container. My PHP instance is in a different container on the same network. I'm using this proxy server: https://github.com/nginx-proxy/nginx-proxy - to manage the moodle installation and other subdomains. From my PHP container: strace -e openat wget -O - https://examplebbserver.com/bigbluebutton/ returns ERROR: The certificate of 'examplebbbserver.com' has expired. Is this relevant at all? Thanks for your time
Comment 7: Yes... Your PHP container does not own updated ca-certificates chains, so when your moodle PHP code tries to contact bbb's API, the https connection fails.
Comment 8: Ok - yep that did it. 1. I downloaded the PEM chain of the BBB server from Firefox -(clicking on the padlock > connection secure > more information > view certificate > download PEM chain 2. Copied the complete chain as .crt files to /usr/share/ca-certificates/ on the php container 3. Ran update-ca-certificates on the php container 4. Ran dpkg-reconfigure ca-certificates on the php container 5. Checked I could now connect to the BBB server from the PHP container using strace -e openat wget -O - https://examplebbserver.com/bigbluebutton/ 6. Got the success code 7. Checked on Moodle and everything is good. Thanks for the support
Comment 9: Well done! What if some crazy man has moodle on IIS and Win2012r2 😁 And and has a same trouble((( Couldt some one new, how to check ssl connnection to BBB from win server, and if it needs insert new CA-s ???
Comment 10: You should be able to check simply by opening a web browser on your server and connecting to the BBB server URL. you should get no warnings and no errors from the https status. If there are errors, use windows update to get the new CAs.
Comment 11: There are no errors with web browser opening bbb and system is up to date.
Comment 12: So, it should work, or maybe your problems (if any) are not related to the expired Let's Encrypt CAs.

Post title: Backup course with BBB recording
Post description: Hi. I was able to backup my courses successfully and have them restored to a new site. However, I was not able to see the BBB session recordings. I have also checked the 'Include Course Log' is ticked as well but I am still having the same problem. Any ideas? Thanks in advance
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: AFAIK , the BBB recordings stay on the BBB server , so into the backup, there will be the resources/ activities that will point to the recordings, but not the recordings themselves (usually they are very large). If you restore your course in a moodle connected to the same BBB server you should be able to view the recordings, otherwise not. To transfer the BBB recordings, you should transfer/copy them between the BBB servers involved.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Scalelite (Lazy Deployment) and Bigbluebutton
Post description: Hi at all. Anyone can tell me if the procedure for obtaining detailed log files described in the web page https://jffederico.medium.com/bigbluebutton-activity-completion-in-moodle-b3269adf4c34 is valid even if the BBB servers are behind Scalelite servers (Lazy Deployment). If not valid, is there a way to have detailed log files in MOODLE using BBB servers  behind Scalelite (Lazy or Blinside Networks Deployment)? Thanks for sharing
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hey Davide, I already told you this. The fact that the BBB server is behind Scalelite or any other Loadbalancer does not affect the outcome. BBB is the one performing the callback. The payload that comes from BBB is received by Moodle through the plugin and stored in the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_logs table. So, if you wanted to extract that data from there you need other plugin. I am guessing that some report plugin or external application such as intelliboard would help you (just guessing).
Comment 2: thanks Jesus, now I try. It is important for my fellow teachers to be able to track student activities in videoconferencing (at least the connection time). We noticed that irregular exits from the meeting (for example closing the browser window) are not noted in the log file. Thank you so much for your valuable work
Comment 3: No, they are not tracked. And there is no way to track those exits because right now there is no way to stream data into Moodle (a BBB limitation) and there is no way to process batch events in Moodle and tie them to a correct timestamp (a Moodle limitation).

Post description: Hi everybody! A moodle and a bbb plugin have been installed (debian 10 64 bit) on a vps for a primary school. The moodle part works perfectly, there are no interruptions. Teachers keep a video lesson for a small number (<20 students) a day using BBB, but we often get an error message like this: bigbluebuttonbn/You have exceeded the max number of concurrent meetings. What could be the problem? Thank you in advance for your help!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Vlagymir, do you have your own BBB server or rented one or do you use the test server from blindsidenetworks? I beleive, they put a limit on concurrent meetings. Maybe you need your "own" one. Regards, Daniel
Comment 2: Dear Daniel,
Comment 3: Hey Vlagyimir, Did you find a solution for that inconvenience?? I'm having the same problem with my Teachers/Students. Sometimes I have to wait 10 to 15 mins sometimes 5 minutes, so I don0t know what could be the issue and I need to resolve this ASAP. I hope we have an answer to this issue, THanks!
Comment 4: Hi, I suppose that, if you use the BigBlueButton's test server, there is a limit on the number of different meetings that can be created, to avoid it being completly oversused and crash. It is a test server, it's not here to be used a lot with lots of users... Séverin
Comment 5: So what could we do to use for lots of users. I couldnt find anything in BBB website.

Comment 9: Would that mean purchasing an additional VPS or a dedicated Server?
Comment 10: Yes you need a separate server from the one you have installed Moodle. This is because some of the ports used by Moodle are also used by BBB and this may cause conflicts.

Comment 4: ```text
#!/bin/bash
# Change  BigBlueButton Module Name.
# Module version = 2019042009
# Module release = 2.3.4
#
# If you do not have rename installed, install it first
# sudo apt install rename
#
# --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/g' {} +
find . -type d -execdir rename 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/' '{}' \+
find . -type f -exec rename 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/' '{}' \;
# --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BigBlueButtonBN/LiveClass1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BIGBLUEBUTTONBN/LIVECLASS1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BIGBLUEBUTTON/LIVECLASS1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/icon-bigbluebutton/icon-liveclass1/g' {} +
```

Post title: How to transfer courses along with recordings sticked to them
Post description: Hello Everybody! I've got a problem and looking for suggestion how to resolve it. My history of using BBB+Moodle started in 2016. That time I've installed VM with Moodle 2.6 and VM with BBB 0.81. We used this system successfully till 2018 year, that time we decided to upgrade Moodle to brand new 3.6.1 and BBB to 2.0 beta. I established new VM, got fresh installation for BBB and I copied all recordings from 0.81 to 2.0. Then I switched off old 0.81 BBB and tested communication of Moodle 2.6 with new BBB server 2.0 and everything worked fine. That time we decided to save time and let both Moodle (old one 2.6 and new one 3.6.1) worked with one instance of BBB 2.0. I was going to move my courses alog with recordings of the old Moodle instance 2.6 to the new one 3.6.1 later and I supposed it should be easy for me, but I mistaken... So I adjusted my firewall and two different Moodle web-sites worked on different ports fine. Untill I decided to upgrade BBB to the latest 2.2 release. The reason was Adobe Flash EOL and I wanted new technologies like HTML5 client, using it on mobile phones and all the new features which appeared in BBB since my last upgrade. I did that upgrade the same way as before - just made fresh installation using BBB-conf script and copied all my folders with recordings to the new VM. Then I set up new Internet connection, because BBB required wide broadband channel, and I changed IP, readjust everything, domain name, firewall and so on. Finally I tested it with new Moodle instance - everything worked fine! I was glad till the moment I tested old Moodle instance 2.6 - it was unsuccessful. Of course I changed secret key (aka SALT), but I din't know should I change URL (I left it the same, because I didn't change domain name, only adjusted new IP in DNS records). Summarizing all up-mentioned my question is: "Does somebody know the way to transfer courses as well as lists of BBB recordings which belong to them from old 2.6 Moodle instance to new 3.6.1" I've tried it today and it transfered with empty list of recordings, only other kind of standard Moodle plugins and other content... The problem is that old 2.6 Moodle also lost all recording lists... I am in despair! Please suggest any workable way to resurrect my webinars! Thanks in advance!

Forum Post: 
Post title: BBB recordings are taking very long time to appear
Post description: Hello dear, we have an environment where Moodle 3.8.2 is used and BBB 2.2.23 is installed on a separate ubuntu 16.04 server . We are using BBB plugin 2.3.4. When we record a session it is taking more than 24 hours to appear in moodle. many recording made two days ago didn't show up yet the processed files is empty /var/bigbluebutton/recording/process/presentation the published files is empty /var/bigbluebutton/recording/publish/presentation/ they only show up in the playback /var/bigbluebutton/published/presentation we run bbb-conf --check and bbb-conf --status and they showed nothing wrong
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: it has been noticed that BBB is parsing them in /var/bigbluebutton/recording/process/presentation one by one. once a folder is done he moves to the next. but it is very slow. each recording is taking more than one hour
Comment 2: Hi Elie, Let me start by poining out that this is not the best place for posting this question. Since it is BBB related you may be better off by asking in the bigblubutton-dev google group. But, you are correct. The recording processor is a single thread process and that is exactly what happens when meetings are to big or the server is processing too many. There have been plans over the years of re-implementing the recording processor but stability and features on the core components always trump this initiative. Let's remember though that the single server deployment is not meant to be run at high scale. In that spirit, and if you don't want to write your own recording processor (which is what every single company in BBB ecosystem is doing for scaling their clusters), you could have multiple bigbluebutton servers under Scalelite. You would not gain speed and compute power by spreading meeting, therefore recording processing between servers, but at the same time, you would increase your capacity for live sessions.
Comment 3: thank you Jesus for your reply

Post title: Moodle slows down when Bigbluebutton API loads recordings
Post description: I have near 800 students cocurrently in near 30 meetings. At the start of meeting because of time needed to load recording, moodle will slow down extremely. CPU usage for mysql proccess will be very high (near 18GHz). Is there any way to solve the performance issue?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Wow, that is a lot! How many servers do you have?, you are supposed to have no more than 100 users per server . For a case like that you should have at least 7 BBB servers behind a loadbalancer or broker such as Sclalite. The other question is, how many recording do you have in that room. There should not be a problem with that, unless you are missing an index in bigbluebuttonbn_logs.

Comment 1: As that is entirely BigBlueButton related, for that I would suggest you to open an issue in bigbluebutton-setup or bigbluebutton-dev google groups. JF
Comment 2: ```text
Hi, I also have the same problem, did you manage to solve it? How did you solve it, thanks
```

Comment 3: That's normal. It means that your processing service finished to process (ie. convert to MP4/webm/opus etc) all your recordings and now it stopped. It will resume again once more /var/bigbluebutton/recording/status/sanity/*.done files appear (i.e. raw recording content that has passed sanity check service and it is now ready to be processed).

They can change the default "Pre- upload presentation" of the bbb plugin. Post title: Some Recordings from BBB don't show up on moodle
Post description: Hi, I'm facing a problem where some recordings are not displayed on Moodle. We are using scalelite balancer as we have BBB multiple servers and I verified that the recording exists on the BBB server and scalelite server I can view the recording directly from the BBB server using the URL https://myurl.com/playback/presentation/2.0/playback.html?meetingId=XXXXXXXX I tried republishing and rebuilding the recording from BBB server hoping it will show up on moodle , but it didn't. Any help would be appreciated. BigBlueButton Server 2.2.4 Moodle 3.8.2 BBB Plugin 2.3.3
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Did you get to bottom of this, we're just starting to see something similar.
Comment 2: Hello - we got to the bottom of our problem - NFS on one of the BBB servers getting dropping out so the recording never got copied across. Once identified we just re-ran the import script to get them all across. Putting it here just in case it helps anyone else!
Comment 3: Thanks for sharing Adam. While reading the question I was wondering how could this be troubleshot, but what you did makes a lot of sense.
Comment 4: Hi, We are also having the same issue with BBB recordings not showing on Moodle. The recording where working fine until a few days ago. I do not know if its related with the fact that we updated the BBB Moodle plugin to the latest version (v2.3.4) a few days ago. @Adam Griffiths said that he solved the problem by re-running the import script. Can anyone please share what is the SSH command that I should use to do that? Or if there is any KB article that explains that? Also anyone has an idea of what the problem is? I run on the BBB server the command bbb-conf –check and it shows no problems. Thanks!
Comment 5: hello - our fix was down to a problem with our scalelite setup rather than BBB. BBB was correctly publishing the recordings. The import script is specific to scalelite and just copies the completed published recordings from individual BBB servers to the central scalelite server. The script is here if you have scalelite - /usr/local/bigbluebutton/core/scripts I've updated our BBBBN plugin to 2.3.4 and moodle to 3.9 today and all is working correctly for us so don't think the plugin is the culprit. Are you using scalelite or is it a single BBB instance? Are any recordings being published? They can start to take days if you stick with webm format and have a lot of sessions on the go. In our busiest period (we had 4 BBB servers and rang between 400-600 users across them with 5-10 meeting, only one webcam showing on each meeting thankfully) I had to change to mp4 (which also made my IOS users happy) to get recordings showing up in anything like a sensible timeframe. Have you used the bbb-record command? Used with --watch it will at least show you the various workers are running - https://docs.bigbluebutton.org/dev/recording.html I also used to fish around the /var/bigbluebutton/published/presentation/ folder, ls -ltr will show latest recordings at bottom which can help diagnose problems. If you haven't signed up to the BBB google groups I would recommend it. I have fixed most problems with a combination of these moodle forums with the google groups.
Comment 6: After upgrading to BBB "2.2.21" all recordings within a course are gone! But I can see them on the BBB server. Moodle version: 3.8.4 BBB moodle plugin version: 2.3.4 BBB server version: 2.2.21
Comment 7: Hi Ricardo, Yeah, that is a BBB issue. A big one. I was not aware of that. And I just reported to the guys who work on the recordings. The recordings are still there. It seems to be the API that is not picking them up. This means that, because it has nothing to do with Moodle or the Plugin, they will show up again after BBB is updated (or patched). Hopefully there will be an update soon. I would recommend you to keep an eye on the bigbluebutton-dev mailing list. Cheers, JF
Comment 8: Alright, I broke my own BBB server :D. And I don't know where exactly the problem is, but I passed the report along. There are two things you can try. 1. Restart your BBB server. It seems that the update includes changing one of the libraries required by the API for accessing the recordings. Since the API is still running, it has the reference to the old version. On restart, the API starts using the new one. 2. If that doesn't work, what worked for me (I was doing something else) was to run bbb-install.sh again (in the same way I did a few weeks ago) right after performing the apt-get update. Can you please report back which one of the procedures (if any) worked for you? Thanks, JF
Comment 9: Hi Jesus, #1 worked for me! Ricardo
Comment 10: Thanks, I saw you response in one of the other posts. Sorry I came to you this late. I was on vacations :D
Comment 11: Hi @jesusfederico @Jesus Federico or anyone else I'm again having issues with Recordings not being published on Moodle. I have been using Moodle with BigBluebutton for some weeks and all was working perfect until a few days ago. The issue is that the recordings from BigBlueButton stopped being published into Moodle. Things I have tried to solve the issue and none of them solve: - Updated from Bigbluebutton v2.2.22 to v2.2.25 - Reboot server after update - Check the server load (CPU, RAM, Disk) and all is fine. Versions I’m using: Moodle Version: 3.9 BigBlueButton Version: 2.2.25 BigBlueButtonBN Plugin Version: 2.3.4 (build 2019042009) Bellow I leave 4 screenshots of BigBlueButton server status. I really appreciate if someone can help me solve the issue. Any advice is appreciated. Thanks! bbb-conf --check               > https://ibb.co/1Kf9N6w bbb-record --list  (part1)  > https://ibb.co/hD6whX8 bbb-record --list  (part2)  > https://ibb.co/x31gDkV bbb-record --watch           > https://ibb.co/7QvbPdF
Comment 12: Hi Felipe, First of all, it is the BigBlueButton server and not the plugin. Second, I just had the same issue in one of my BBB servers for development a few days ago. Restarting did not work, so what I did was to run bbb-install.sh again. The thing is that bbb-install.sh comes with a bunch of other checks to verify your configuration files. In your case I would try that first. If that post your question to the bigbluebutton-setup google group. There are hundreds of System administrators there. They may have run into that issue too. The thing is that me, personally, I am not working directly in BigBlueButton development at the moment. Mostly integrations and infrastructure, so I am not up to date with the updates that are done every week. Cheers, JF
Comment 13: Hi @Ricardo Caiado Glad to see it work for you. Can you please tell me what option did you use to make it work: 1. Restart your BBB server 2. Run bbb-install.sh again Thanks
Comment 14: 1. Restart your BBB server

Post title: BBB playback report
Post description: Hello! Comments associated with the post:

Post title: How to download a BBB recording with presentation from moodle
Post description: We have a local BBB server installed in our institute. We also have BBB plugin from our moodle server configured to connect to this server for recording.  I have admin access to both the servers. Using BBB from moodle, I conducted an online class for my students, in which I taught using a presentation uploaded to BBB.  This session was recorded. After the session, I am able to view the recording and play it from moodle. But, I am not getting an option to download the video (containing both the presentation and the speaker view) .  If I right-click on the video of myself speaking, the speaker video alone is downloadable, without the presentation. The download feature of the entire session is important, because the video will be auto-removed from the server after two weeks and my students need the recording downloaded by then, for future reference. 1) Is there a proper BBB recording download procedure that can be made available to teachers and students, from moodle (for downloading the entire session)? 2) Is there a way to download this recording using BBB server's web interface? If not, what is a good workaround? 3) Is there a way to get a teacher's conference room created from moodle to be listed as a conference room under the same person's BBB user account?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: 1) Is there a proper BBB recording download procedure that can be made available to teachers and students, from moodle (for downloading the entire session)? No, it is not possible to download the recording as is because it is an HTML page that includes several elements. One per resource used in BBB. 2) Is there a way to download this recording using BBB server's web interface? If not, what is a good workaround? No, the issue is the format of the recording not the way they are accessed.
Comment 2: Thank you for the information.  We could get some scripts using which download as a single mp4 is made possible.  We will try to integrate that to our BBB server in a user friendly manner.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Can i host Moodle and BigBlueButton together on a sever?
Post description: Hi all, I am a newbie to Moodle. I am trying to use BigBlueButton plugin on my Moodle site for web conferencing. So far i understand should not use the BigBlueButton test server and I need to host BigBlueButton on my own server. I have an EC2 for moodle. Can i host Moodle and BigBlueButton together on my only one EC2? Or if i host BigBlueButton on a dedicated server, can i access it from multiple Moodle site?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You could, if you had a server that is large enough for supporting BBB, but with a major tweak to nginx, and only under specific circumstances that include to be using Ubuntu 18.04, to install Moodle on Nginx manually. Of course, you must be comfortable performing System Administrator tasks on linux and have root access on that server. And even in that case, we (the BBB and BN developers) don't recommend to go that way. You will be better off by installing BBB in a separated machine. JF
Comment 2: Thank you so much for your reply.May i know if i host the BBB on a separated server, can i access it from my multiple moodle sites ?
Comment 3: Absolutely. You can access that BBB server even from apps other than Moodle if you have the correct App for that (Greenlight for example).
Comment 4: Thanks again.

Post title: BigBlueButton alternative version
Post description: Hello, everyone. We use Moodle 3.8 and as for conferences we use BigBlueButton, we tried BBB BN as well but every time the veiw of the room is the same. But in this video starting from 2 min 40 seconds the view of the room is different. There is a separate window for video which we like because in other versions as soon as you turn on the video, presantation becomes small. Also I saw the possibility to upload audio from a computer. I can't understand where we can get this versions? Or maybe they are not updating at the moment and there aren't availible plugins for 3,8.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Ksenia, I am going through long time old (no that long too) posts and found this one. I don't have access to the video you posted, and I am not quite sure I understand your question, but I can tell you this. There is only one official distribution of BigBlueButton, although there are several versions available for production. We (as the developers of BigBlueButton) encourage people to use the latest one. At this time, the latest version is 2.2, and it is what you find in Moodle Cloud , test-install (the server configured by default with the BigBlueButtonBN plugin), and any of our servers (Blindside Networks servers). Now, that being said. If you have your own BBB server, you need to configure the BigBlueButtonBN plugin for using your own server by replacing the configuration that comes by default. And that is unrelated to the version of the plugin, or Moodle. Just to recap, there are thre components here Moodle + BigBlueButtonBN plugin for Moodle + BigBlueButton
