Forum Post: 
Post title: BBB plugin - recording files
Post description: I have a server that is cloud and I set up BBB in it. I have another server which I set up moodle in it with big storage. My question is how can I save recording videos in my moodle server what i mean can I save recordings in moodle as i don't have enough storage in BBB server? best regards
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You cannot do that. The recordings are actually stored in the BigBlueButton server. What you see in the Room or Acivity are links that are tetrieved form the BBB server once (and only while) the recordings are available in the BigBlueButton server after being processed. What you could do is to mount some external disk to your BBB server, NFS or something else. But that will require major surgery. You can find documentation about that in https://docs.bigbluebutton.org or ask for more ideas in bigbluebutton-setup mailing list.
Comment 2: Thank you.
Comment 3: hi  @ Jesus Federico - I installed bbb in moodle but i cannot show recordings in greenlight  server why? if you can help me thanks
Comment 4: I don't understand your question. What is your setup?. Either way recordings from sessions in Moodle wont show up in Greenlight. They are different applications.
Comment 5: This is a huge nonsense. While web cam recordings can be downloaded, presentations and screen sharing recordings are not downloaded. Post title: Moodle integration
Post description: Hi, I'm using moodle v3.8.2 together with BBB v2.2. Is it possible to use my private BBB through the plug in? I
could not figure out how to do. Thank you
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You can modify the file config-dist.php of the plug in with your URL and secret. This is the default configuration: $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['server_url'] = ' http://test-install.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/' ; $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['shared_secret'] = '8cd8ef52e8e101574e400365b55e11a6';
Comment 2: You only do that if you want the setting to disapear for administrators. Otherwise they can use the Admin UI through the Plugin Settings.
Comment 3: If those are your own Moodle and BBB servers, yes. You just go to the settings of the plugin and at the very top, replace the URL and secret with your BBB server ones. If you are on someone elese Moodle server, the feature may have been removed so you are not able to change it.

Post description: Looking to start remote teaching of 50  or more students at a time. I only have access to a laptop, and a wireless connection of around 600 kbps. I have Moodle set up on a VPS but I would need to set up a BBB server . Technically all possible. But what are my chances of having a workable system at that sort of scale? Audio only would be fine.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Is the 600Kbps between you and the server or between the server and the world?. I find the reliability of the network connection is of great importance as well as the speed.
Comment 2: Me and the world. I am in Manila, the server in Singapore and the students in China. I may be able to get a faster mobile connection but no access to a wired connection.
Comment 3: Am I right in assuming BBB uses HTML 5 and students can use the browser on movie phones to join and chat with a session? Only the moderator needs to use a computer?
Comment 4: You can test BBB in MoodleCloud. Even the free plan comes with a 10 user BBB session.
Comment 5: That occurred to me too. However even if I got 10 users up and running I am still far short of my class sizes. Zoom appears to have a very generous free account and signing up to a level where I can get the REST API and using the Zoom plug-in looks attractive. It may be too good to be true. I can't see much comment here on Zoom. I will give it a try

Forum Post: 
Post title: Improving Web Conferencing Software
Post description: (Post removed on request of poster)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: HI Jules, We would LOVE to have HTML5 BBB on Moodle. Flash is out of the question for us. It seems there is a release but we cant access it on the blindsidenetworks test server . This seems to be taking an awfully long time. The demo was out in 2017. I'm keen to be interviewed. Rob Mills
Comment 2: Hi Rob, Good news.  We have released BigBlueButton 2.2-beta, which is the first version where the HTML5 client comes to the foreground as the main client. We made the announcement here to our bigbluebutton-dev mailing list: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/bigbluebutton-dev/34SphncjKEw/KJZsbQbEAQAJ . Here's a quote from our announcement The BigBlueButton HTML5 client runs without plugins. There is no Flash, no Java , and no mobile app needed to run the HTML5 client.  The client takes advantage of the latest capabilities of FireFox and Chrome (the recommended browsers on the desktop) and mobile Safari (for iOS 11+ iPhones and iPads). The HTML5 client uses the browser's support for web real-time communication (webRTC) to send and receive high-quality audio, video, and screen sharing.  You'll find the shared video of higher quality than the Flash client.  We use FreeSWITCH for WebRTC audio and Kurento for WebRTC video/screen sharing. The HTML5 client implements the full capabilities for the presenter upload presentation, pan/zoom, and annotate using whiteboard tools (including multi-user whiteboard). The HTML5 client offers more collaboration capabilities (compared with the Flash client) including built-in shared notes (using EtherPad) and ability to share YouTube video during the session (though the shared YouTube video does not appear yet in the recording). The HTML5 client runs on desktop, laptop, chromebook, and mobile devices.  It implements a responsive interface (written in React) that automatically adapts to the screen size.  This means the *same* code and interface is now running across all these devices.  For mobile devices there is no app to install. The HTML5 client runs with the mobile browser which on iOS is mobile Safari browser and on Android is Chrome.  These browsers support using WebRTC to send/receive audio and video.  The supported operating systems on mobile devices is iOS 11+ for Apple iPhones/iPads and Android 6.0+.  The device must support the h.264 codec (which is supported by iOS and most Android phones). We've been testing earlier builds of the HTML5 client on our test server at https://test.bigbluebutton.org/ . While BigBlueButton anyone can use BigBlueButton as a general web conferencing system, the project focuses on the needs of the instructor and student for online learning. With our announcement, anyone can setup their own BigBlueButton server (with HTML5 client as default) by following the install steps at: http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/html/html5-install.html . Regards,... Fred Dixon BigBlueButton HTML5 developer

Forum Post: 
Post title: BBB instance type explanation needed
Post description: Hello, Can you explain mod_bigbluebuttonbn version 2.2.6 (2017101014) settings; 1. When you create a new BBB-activity on course you can choose instance type Room/Activity with recordings Room/Activity only Recordings only What is the difference between these settings? 2. Under "Activity/Room settings"-topic you can choose "Session can be recorded" Why is this setting here if instance type dictates that the session can be recorded? Or do you need both: "Room/Activity with recordings" "Session can be recorded" before you can record the session?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Urpo, Very simple. Room/Activity with recordings, is the normal and regular room we have had since BigBlueButtonBN version 2.0. Meaning an instance that can be used for joining sessions that may be recorded. If they are and have recording linked to them, the recordings are shown at the bottom. Room Activity only, similar to the first one, BUT with no recordings. This instances won;t give the users even the possibility of recording the session. It is normally used for give students an space for collaboration with no need to be worried about space or the content they recorded. If an existen room is changed to this type, the existent recordings will remain in BBB but they won't be shown. Recordings only, Since the inception of BigBlueButtonBN version 2.2, the plugin named RecordingsBN that was used for showing all the recordings in a course, has been phased out. The reason for that is that there was too many duplicated code and it is always more difficult to maintain more than one plugin. Specially when they have similar functionality. So, In order to have an instance for showing all the recordings in one course you select this type. You can also use this type if you want to show only one recording (or a small set of them) by importing recording from another instance in the same course, or even in a different one. I hope this clarifies things. Cheers, JF
Comment 2: Hello, Thanks for answering my first question. If I use Room/Activity with recordings do I still need to choose also Session can be recorded -checkbox ? If so don't you think this is redudant now when you can choose this with the room type?
Comment 3: Well, I think you have your response already but anyways, I'll give you a use case :D. Lets say a teacher wants to have a room with recordings for student collaboration showing a recording from a different course but only want them to have meetings that  should not be recorded. You may argue that students won't have access to start/stop recordngs anyways, but they could if you want to give them moderator capabilites. I know, the convinations are endless, but this is the thing, this plugin has been growing in features and capabilities based on user requests. What does't make much sense to you may be the only way to solve someone else problem. My advice is always to look for the settings that will work for you particular use cases and try to set them up by default, this way your users don't have to be worried for too many combinations. I would say that in your case, if you prefer no to see the checkbox but still want to have all the meetings with the option for being recorded, add this to your config.php $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['recording_default'] = 1; $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['recording_editable'] = 0; I hope this helps. JF

Forum Post: 
Post title: Password protect BBB virtual classroom
Post description: We're using the BBB Moodle plugin and have a need to restrict teachers from certain BBB virtual classes. We have courses with several teachers enrolled in them. We want to restrict teachers from entering certain BBB virtual classes in the course. I was thinking it could be done by password protecting the BBB virtual class, but don't see that option available. Is there an option to set a password for a BBB virtual class in Moodle?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Gred, Negative. That use case (access with password after the user is already authenticated!) is not covered and it has never been intended to cover it. For restricting access to a room to some users (including teachers) you could use groups and to use an special role for those teachers (non-editing teacher may be used, but I would rather create a custom one for that particular use case. Lets call it TA). Then you enroll the TAs into the course/groups you want them to have access, and for the activity you can add them as moderators in the list of participants. The groups should be set up as "separated". You may have to play around  with the options until you get the set up you need. Good luck, Jesus Federico
Comment 2: Thanks, I thought that was the case. And how do I confirm that they can't enter the BBB virtual classroom--by logging in as them and trying?
Comment 3: No luck with this. I could not exclude users with Teacher roles from entering the BBB virtual classroom using in the Participants tab. I removed the Access All Groups permission from the Teacher role in the course, created a group containing only the instructor I want to have access to the BBB VC, but any user with the Teacher role can enter it.

Forum Post: 
Post title: BigBlueButton - is there a way to NOT show the recordings to the students
Post description: We let students record their sessions in BBB, but the BigBlueButtonBN plugin shows the recordings afterwards, also to the students, which we do not want. Is there a way that the recordings are hidden for the students but shown for the teacher? WE use BBB 1.1 with the latest plugin. The old BBB plugins were fine in that, but now the recordings are integrated in the BigBlueButtonBN plugin. A pity because there is another plugin specially for showing the recordings. Hope to hear from you. Many thanks. Nick
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Nick, I think there is a misconception here on what the capabilities in the previous version were and the ones the current one are. With BigBlueButtonBN 2.1.x the recordings belonging to a Room were also shown to all the uses who have access to the Room. RecordingsBN was used as a view in order to show ALL the recordings in a course. But this use case was not changed at all. With BigBlueButtonBN 2.2, the functionality offered by these two plugins was merged, which means that you can have an instance that has a Room/Activity with no recordings, it can be a Room/Activity showing its own recordings (same as the standard Room in v2.1.x) or a resource with Recordings only (same as an instance of the previous RecordingsBN) The use case you are trying to cover has never been considered, although you were able to hide the recordingsBN instance from students using the Moodle capabilities. Nonetheless, there is a workaround you could try. This would be to create a group per user in that course and enroll them. Students should see only the recordings for the group (or groups) they belong, but Teachers should be able to see all of them. I hope this helps. JF

Post title: I can not configure my server ip for moodle
Post description: I am using a ubunto where I have my moodle installed. Soon I installed the moodle plugin and tried to generate the secret key, but when I put it as example 157.86.6.226. I already gave the file --check and shows me the following information: apice @ apice: / var / www $ sudo bbb-conf --check [sudo] password for apice: BigBlueButton Server 1.1.0 (564) Kernel version: 4.4.0-62-generic Distribution: Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS (64-bit) Memory: 8174 MB /var/www/bigbluebutton/client/conf/config. xml (bbb-client) Port test (tunnel): 157.86.6.226 red5: 157.86.6.226 useWebrtcIfAvailable: true /opt/freeswitch/etc/freeswitch/sip_profiles/external.xml (FreeSWITCH) websocket port: 5066 WebRTC enabled: true / etc / nginx / sites-available / bigbluebutton (nginx) server name: 157.86.6.226 port: 5080, [::]: 5080 bbb-client dir: / var / www / bigbluebutton /var/lib/tomcat7/webapps/bigbluebutton/WEB-INF/classes/bigbluebutton.properties (bbb-web) bbb-web host : 157.86.6.226 /usr/share/red5/webapps/bigbluebutton/WEB-INF/red5-web.xml (red5) voice conference: FreeSWITCH /usr/local/bigbluebutton/core/scripts/bigbluebutton.yml (record and playback) playback host: 157.86.6.226 ** Potential problems described below ** # IP does not match: # IP from ifconfig: 10.10.10.226 # / etc / nginx / sites-available / bigbluebutton: 157.86.6.226 .................... # Error: Could not connect to the configured hostname / IP address # # http://157.86.6.226/ # # If your BigBlueButton server is behind a firewall, see FAQ. # Error: Unable to connect to port 1935 (RTMP) on 157.86.6.226 # Error: Unable to reach default URL for presentation: # # http://157.86.6.226/default.pdf ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ How do I also generate a new password without being the one I set? apice @ apice: / var / www $ bbb-conf --secret URL: http://157.86.6.226/bigbluebutton/ Secret: avenida689 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- In the test URL appears the xml normally ... and already with my calls an error page. Being that I'm using moodle and not with an API http://test-install.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Your BigBlueButton server is not correctly installed. You have to follow the steps in this document (including the troubleshooting part as you have some issues there) http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/install/install.html As this issue has nothing to do with Moodle, you should look for help in the BigBlueButton mailing lists. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-setup The main problem is that you installed BBB in the same server you installed Moodle. And even though that is possible, it requires some black magic for proxying the requests. You should better install them in separated boxes. I don't know what exactly you did, but right now it seems that you have two applications listening the port 80. You have to have a way to redirect the request to the application you really want. JF

Forum Post: 
Post title: Big Blue Button sessions keep disconnecting
Post description: I'm using Big Blue Button on Moodle 3.1.2 I typically use Google Chrome (as do most of my students) With 3 people (2 students and 1 teacher) everything works fine. With 4 people (3 students and 1 teacher) it simply gives a message that the session has been disconnected and closes the session for all participants. I typically have groups of 4 people (1 Teacher and 3 students) and have not had a problem until yesterday. However, since yesterday, it is impossible to run session with 4 participants (3 students and 1 teacher). Any suggestions on how to overcome this would be greatly appreciated.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This is an issue entirely related to BigBlueButton itself and no to the Moodle plugin. If you have your own BigBlueButton server you may want to try asking for help in the bigbluebutton mailing lists. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-dev or https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-setup If you are using test-install (the server that comes by default), there may have been an issue with the server at the time you were testing. The problems don't usually just happen, so an update was in process or it is on its way. With test-install you either have to be patient and wait or report it to the bigbluebutton mailing list as it may be an issue the developers are not aware of. Cheers, JF
Comment 2: Thanks Jesus, I'm using the standard plugin on Moodle, since I'm currently using shared hosting on CPanel (and apparently I can't install BBB there. I'm going to run a stress test tonight with multiple users to check if everything's now ok. I appreciate your feedback. It's good to know there's nothing else I should be doing on my side.
Comment 3: The plugin doesn't do anything by itself. The plugin let you create Moodle activities that will let you make use of some functionality inside the LMS, BUT, you have to have a BigBlueButton server where to run the meetings. It is true that the plugin comes pre-configured to work with a BigBlueButton server provided for free by Blindside Networks, BUT (again) it is not meant to be for production, only for testing. It is OK if you use the server as much as you need/want. The server works normally fine, but as it is used (for free) by lots of users daily it may be overloaded in times. Also it always runs the latest build with gives users access to all the new features and capabilities, although the downside of that is also that in times there may be hidden bugs not detected in development. Cheers, JF
Comment 4: Hi Jesus, Thanks for the explanation. It's really helpful. So far, I stuck with the Moodle plugin pre-configured to connect to the BBB server just because the functionality of the plugin is fantastic. It seems like it's time to move on. So now I need to ask what might be a dumb question. Is it possible to connect the BBB plugin to my own server installation of BBB (instead of BBB's server).
Comment 5: Yes it is! And it's the recommended way tu use BigBlueButton. But, you have to install your own BigBlueButton server , on a dedicated server .

Post title: Big Blue Button Issues | Request for guidance
Post description: Hi, I'm building a platform to provide free online training for CLAT (akin to LSAT in India) for students from marginalized and underprivileged communities (including students with disabilities). It will be for free of cost. Our team wants to explore the option of having online classes on BBB (as our students are from all across India - we operate across 18 states!) We ran a test run of BBB with three people. I'm hosting my BBB on a DO server (4GB Ram). All of us had decent internet connection (40Mbps). However, our connection kept dropping and voices kept breaking. I wanted to know if anyone could help me solve this problem or have any suggestions about what could be a good sub to BBB. We want to provide the best remote learning experience for our students (including those who may not have great internet connection). Thank you in advance! Anusha
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Anusha, Were you using the Bangalore data center ?   you really need the 4core 8GB droplet at a minimum. Its not as good as a bare metal implemention,  but you can definitely use this for small meetings with no issues at all. you need less than <100kb to listen to the conference,  video and deskshare will be the items causing low bandwidth users issues.   The presentation/whiteboard should work flawlessly. Also, make sure you installed havaged on your server, that can cause issues if not. regards, Stephen hostbbb.com

Forum Post: 
Post title: BigBlueButton: Old Recordings Suddenly Disappeared, New Recordings Never Appear
Post description: Hi, I have been running BBB successfully on my Moodle site for over a year, possibly longer; I have been using http://test-install.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/ . It has been a terrific plugin, and really helpful for me, and for my students. Last week my server 's hard drive failed, and I had to restore from the recent backup that I fortunately had. Since then, all of my previous recordings have vanished, meaning that the entry for the every one of my previous recordings (about 30 of them) says "There are no recording for this meeting." More than that, new recordings that I (thought) I made are producing the same message. The lecture streams just fine, I have online students who see it just fine in realtime, but the lecture is not being recorded. And yes, I did have the "Session can be recorded" checkbox checked (that is my default setting for the BBB plugin). I am also aware that the recordings go away after 14 days; however, unless my memory is failing me, I recall that the link to the recording is still visible in the BBB activity; it produces the "this recording is not available" only when that link is clicked. For me now, all of those links are gone. I have been testing it tonight, and no recordings are happening. The only error message I have found is in the Chrome developer's console, which said that the html5 server returned a 404 (not found) error. I see nothing in my server's logfiles (I refer to the server files, not the moodle logfiles, or the BBB/RBN logfiles; I don't know where those logfiles are located.) My version of BBB is 2.1.1 (2016051905), RecordingsBN is 1.3.0 (2016051904), Moodle 3.1.2 (build 20161027). My server is OSX Lion, running (among other things) MySQL v5.6.33 and PHP v5.6.27. It's worth saying, maybe, that the hard drive crash/restore may not be relevant; it may only be co-incidental. Can you suggest an approach I can take to diagnose this issue, and hopefully fix it? While it would be great to get my recordings back (the last 14 days, anyway), more important to me is to be able to make new recordings going forward. Thanks in advance! Cheers, Kevin

Forum Post: 
Post title: Looking for bigger Big Blue Button users
Post description: Dear all, We are running a Moodle site with 10 000+ users and a virtual classroom installation with up to 500 simultaneous users. We are looking for an alternative virtual classroom that can support this number of simultaneous users (divided over a dozen concurrent  sessions or more). We have been looking at BBB now and again and recently it has started to include the functionality we need (recording, breakout rooms, etc.), so now I wonder if there are any users of BBB out there who have installations of similar or bigger size, so that I can ask them about the hardware infrastructure we would require to set up a server that is sufficiently powerful for our needs. I also have a number of questions about possible functionality (to which I have not yet been able to find the answers on-line): Can one BBB server serve virtual classrooms to two Moodle sites if they are in the same Moodle server? Does the Moodle integration limit BBB sessions to accept only users authenticated via Moodle, or is it also possible to have people from outside of Moodle access the session (acccess via a link)? Will the number of Breakout rooms be flexible (5 seems to few for our class sizes)? Thanks in advance for any information you can share. Rgrds, Paul.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Paul, Can one BBB server serve virtual classrooms to two Moodle sites if they are in the same Moodle server? Yes, it can serve multiple Moodle sites, servers an even other systems (like Wordpress) with no problem. Each session will have its own meetinID therefore users will join the meetings they have access to. Does the Moodle integration limit BBB sessions to accept only users authenticated via Moodle, or is it also possible to have people from outside of Moodle access the session (acccess via a link)? The Moodle integration only allows access through Moodle activities , and only to authenticated users will be able to join. For allowing access through a shared link you would need to tailor an special link. The plugin does not provide that capability. Will the number of Breakout rooms be flexible (5 seems to few for our class sizes)? The number of 5 rooms is fixed and it was defined that way to simplify the UI JF
Comment 2: Hi Jesus, Thanks for your swift replies. Rgrds, Paul.
Comment 3: Hi all, I am still hoping to find Moodlers who employ BBB on a big installation with many users. Before adopting BBB we need to be certain it can handle 500 simultaneous users. I know it depends on the server and connection, but it would be of great help if we knew that there are bigger BBB installations out there and if we could find out what kind of hardware and infrastructure it requires. Rgrds, Paul.

Forum Post: 
Post title: [BBB] RecordingsBN uses internal IP address instead of domain
Post description: For some reason, RecordingsBN uses a playback presentation link with my internal IP address from Amazon AWS EC2 instead of the external IP or domain . An entry of a recording looks like this: 
```text
http://172.x.x.x
/playback/presentation/0.9.0/playback.html?meetingId=xxxxx-xxx
```
 instead of 
```text
https://bbb.mydomain.com/
...
```
 AFAICS, the only occurence of my internal IP address in the bbb configuration is /usr/local/bigbluebutton/core/scripts/bigbluebutton.yml : 
```text
playback_host: 172.x.x.x


playback_protocol: https
```
 Should this point to my domain, external IP or internal IP? Maybe someone can point me in the right direction to find the cause of this. bbb-record --check also does not output anything. Versions: RecordingsBN: 1.3.0-beta BBB: 1.0 Moodle: 3.0
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: RecordingsBN uses a playback presentation as it is/was received from BBB. So, what you need to fix is either the endpoint on BBB or the recordings already processed. If you haven done it yet, execute this command sudo bbb-conf --setip bbb.yourdomain.com You'll need to restart the server , but once fixed the new recordings will have the new endpoint. Now, for fixing the recordings already processed, you need to reprocess them. sudo bbb-record --rebuild <recordID> You can find more information in the BBB documentation http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/dev/recording.html#process and more help with BBB in BBB forums. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-users

Forum Post: 
Post title: icons for Hide and Delete do nothing
Post description: Greetings, Thanks again for your great product and updates. bbb helps us enable synchronous learning to a large number of our partner colleges and universities and we are grateful for this! Issue#1 : We've installed RecordingsBN v 1.2.1 onto our Moodle v 3.0.2 and observed that the icons for Hide and Delete do nothing on mod/recordingsbn/view.php You see a pop up when you click Delete asking if you're sure, and you click Yes to confirm, but the recording stays. This is observed even after refreshing the page. Furthermore, I had to turn on UI as html : changed from No (unchecked) to Yes (checked) in order to see these recordings. Also attempted while UI as html feature can be edited is set to Yes. Another fellow reported the same issue down in the comments (January 2016).
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi David, Thanks for reporting this issue. There is a problem with the YUI library in that particular version. For some people the recordings are shown for others they are not. And the toolbar seems to be broken since the last update, on Moodle 2.9.5+ (Build: 20160317) works with no problems. As you noticed, the best workaround for now is to use the plain html UI. Although the toolbar should work with plain html, it does for me on Moodle 3.0.3+ (Build: 20160317) . A few questions. 1. What version of the BigBlueButtonBN you have? 2. What BigBlueButton server are you using? test-install? your own? a hosted server? Depending of the BBB server you are using the actions over recordings can take a few seconds to be processed (up to 10), but you should see a spinning wheel while the request is processed. 3. If you clean caches both in Moodle and your browser, do you still see the problem? 4. If you activate the developer console in your browser (Chrome or Firefox F12) do you see any error message coming? 5. Can you confirm out of moodle if the actions on recordings can be performed? Or, what about in BigBlueButtonBN, can you perform actions to the recordings there? JF
Comment 2: 1. What version of the BigBlueButtonBN you have? 2.0.4 (2015080611) 2. What BigBlueButton server are you using? test-install? your own? a hosted server? Our own. Depending of the BBB server you are using the actions over recordings can take a few seconds to be processed (up to 10), but you should see a spinning wheel while the request is processed. 3. If you clean caches both in Moodle and your browser, do you still see the problem? The toolbar problem? Yes 4. If you activate the developer console in your browser (Chrome or Firefox F12) do you see any error message coming? Yes: Uncaught Error: Bootstrap's JavaScript requires jQuery 5. Can you confirm out of moodle if the actions on recordings can be performed? Or, what about in BigBlueButtonBN, can you perform actions to the recordings there? The toolbar icons work when used in mod/bigbluebuttonbn/view.php
Comment 3: Hi David, I think I got it. It seems to be a bug in the latest version of RecordingsBN. Can you try this version https://github.com/blindsidenetworks/moodle-mod_recordingsbn/archive/develop.zip It will be 1.2.2 (2015080608) Thanks, JF
Comment 4: Any feedback on this David?
Comment 5: Jesus, I will test the new version soon, hopefully today, and report back to you.

Post title: Create BBB-Activity does not work
Post description: 1) bbb-conf --check BigBlueButton Server 0.9.1 (355) Kernel version: 3.13.0-77-generic Distribution: Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS (64-bit) Memory: 3999 MB /var/www/bigbluebutton/client/conf/config. xml (bbb-client) Port test (tunnel): yyy.xxxxxx.org Red5: yyy.xxxxxx.org useWebrtcIfAvailable: true /opt/freeswitch/conf/sip_profiles/external.xml (FreeSWITCH) websocket port: 5066 WebRTC enabled: true /etc/nginx/sites-available/bigbluebutton (nginx) server name: yyy.xxxxxx.org port: 80 bbb-client dir: /var/www/bigbluebutton /var/lib/tomcat7/webapps/bigbluebutton/WEB-INF/classes/bigbluebutton.properties (bbb-web) bbb-web host : yyy.xxxxxx.org /usr/share/red5/webapps/bigbluebutton/WEB-INF/red5-web.xml (red5) voice conference: FreeSWITCH capture video: true capture desktop: true /usr/local/bigbluebutton/core/scripts/bigbluebutton.yml (record and playback) playback host: yyy.xxxxxx.org ** Potential problems described below ** 2) Demo session on this server - OK 3) Module BigBlueButton (2.0.4) install to Moodle-Instance - OK 4) Module BigBlueButton configure with data from "sudo bbb-conf --salt" - OK 5) Create BBB-Activity - ERROR Debug info: Error code: general_error_unable_connect Stack trace: line 463 of /lib/setuplib.php: moodle_exception thrown line 55 of /mod/bigbluebuttonbn/mod_form.php: call to print_error() line 191 of /lib/formslib.php: call to mod_bigbluebuttonbn_mod_form->definition() line 86 of /course/moodleform_mod.php: call to moodleform->moodleform() line 255 of /course/modedit.php: call to moodleform_mod->moodleform_mod() 6) Module BigBlueButton configure with URL : http://test-install.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/ Secret: 8cd8ef52e8e101574e400365b55e11a6 7) Create BBB-Activity - OK Please help me!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The Moodle instance and BigBlueButton are on different servers.
Comment 2: The cause was a lack of configuration Moodle server.
Comment 3: Could you be more precise? ; it could be useful for someone else... Thanks in advance
Comment 4: This is a rare situation. I exchanged the IP addresses of both servers in the past. When changing them the virtual network adapter eth0:0 with its original IP address was set on the server with the moodle-instance. Thats why the moodle-instance didn’t forward the request to the BBB-server but to its own webserver.
Comment 5: Hi Rudolf, I am glad you solved your problem. Error code: general_error_unable_connect Generally speaking means that your Moodle server was not able to communicate with your BigBlueButton server. That can be a firewall issue, a DNS issue, routing issue, etc. Just in case anyone else faces this problem, the best way to test it is to execute in your console: curl http://your-bbb-server/bigbluebutton/api The response should be an XML file, the same you get if you use that URL in the browser. If that doesn't work you can confirm that the connectivity issue is there and more likely you'll get a message error telling you where exactly the problem is. Regards, JF
Comment 6: Hi Jesus, exactly these steps have led me to the correct solution. Regards, Rudolf

Post title: Connect Moodle with BBB server on HTTPS
Post description: Hello community. Has anyone managed to connect Moodle on https with BigBlueButton on https protocol too? I'm using Moodle 2.6.11+ on https and need to connect with BBB 0.91 server on https. Both of the two domains, as the Moodle domain as the BBB server domain, have their certificates ok. Plug-in version is 2.0.3 (2015080610) and when I try to connect them I have an URL error. Of course the SALT is introduced correctly. In BBB Goolgle forums, one of the developers told me the plug-in is not updated yet to support https, but if anyone has got it, I appreciate could help me. Thanks in advance. JP
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Juan Pablo, I responded in the google forums. The plugin is just right. My bet is that the problem is with the SSL certificate you have in your BBB server. Did you do what I asked you to do? I did no receive any response. We can follow-up here or there, but please use only one channel. Regards, JF
Comment 2: Hi Jesus, again... I have entered here to tell the mates that the plug-in is correct and goes OK on HTTPS... Yes I've found your response in the Google forums few moments ago. And have done you asked me to do. There you have an answer from me. If you agree we follow-up in Google forums since we start this there, but I would really like people in this Moodle forum could read the information too. Perhaps finally putting here a link to the Google forums thread... Best regards and thanks a lot. JP
Comment 3: Hi all, I would like to explain I had a mistake in the Moodle server configuration. All I had to do was put in the correct DNS server's IP in Bind configuration and the BBB server was reachable since then. Also I putted in other DNS servers' IPs as Google ones (8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) Hope this usefull for someone. JP

Post title: Uloading of presentation documents to BigBlueButton and recording not working
Post description: Hello everyone! I recently installed Moodle 2.9 on one machine and BigBlueButton 0.9.1 on the other. I also installed both BigBlueButton Moodle plugins and configured to use my BigBlueButton server . Users can enter the meeting, share microphone, camera, desktop,... but moderators can't upload any presentation files or start the recording. Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Ted, Hopefully you found a solution already, but in case anyone else finds this post I wanted to mention some testing steps that anyone running their own BigBlueButton server should try first. I recommend installing the BigBlueButton API demos on the server and testing BigBlueButton using the demos. If you run into problems using the demos it's probably your BigBlueButton setup at fault. Then you should head over to the BigBlueButton discussion groups for help. - Jeremy

Post title: Need Troubleshooting steps BBB Moodle 2.8.3 recordings missing
Post description: Hi, Earlier this month our tech services dept updated the BBB server .  They were careful to copy the salt to the new config file and we can still operate our server as normal.  One hitch though. We now cannot see our recordings in Moodle. I switched back to the Blindside test server and salt and the recordings work fine.  So something has become derailed in the process of setting up the new BBB server. I'm pretty new to Moodle and BBB so I would appreciate any advice or troubleshooting steps that you can offer to help me find the problem between the new server and my Moodle installation. Thanks--Cheryl
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The problem may be at the BigBlueButton serverserver level if by migration what really happened was that the server was installed in a new box/vm. If this is the case  the recordings should also be moved from one BBB server to the other. There is documentation in docs.bogbluebutton.org that may help you solve the problem, or more help can be asked directly to the bigbluebutton-setup google group https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-setup JF

Forum Post: 
Post title: Issue with BBB Recordings
Post description: Hi All, I currently have Moodle 2.85 installation with the latest BBB plugins. I am using Genericconf as the BBB server . When I create an activity for a BBB recording it records the session as I can see this in the Genericconf logs. However when I have created the BBBrecordings resource and click on it there is no recording, it is completely blank. Yet, when I use the Blindside networks test server I can see the recording correctly. I am helping a client out who is on a budget here in Australia. I am only a novice user of Moodle so any hope or pointers of how to get things behaving would be appreciated. Thank you in advance.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Tina, First thing you need to check is if the recording or recordings actually exist in the BigBlueButton server you are trying to connect. If you are running a BBB 0.9, sometimes the users forget to push the recording button (even though the meeting was set to be recorded, the user must push the button to really start recording). Or for any versions, sometimes the recording was not processed for some reason. I would recommend you to do a direct request to the BBB server by using api-mate http://mconf.github.io/api-mate/ (or ask to your system administrator to do so) You can query all the recordings and look for the one you need by title, or if the recordings are too many then you need the internal meeting ID and query for recordings in that specific meetingID. Let us know your findings
Comment 2: Thank you Jesus.  I have entered the data into the that link. How do I tell if the recording exist from it please. I am the technical person trying to solve this, I am more a support person than a web support person. Once I can understand the output of the link I can give you that information and we can resolve this issue. I have looked at the Generic Conf and I can see that the meetings have been recorded on their server.
Comment 3: Looking at the API Mate. I clicked on getRecordings and it returned code "Success" so I assume that the recording is present on the Generic Conf server given that information. And then when I click on publishRecordings I get "Success" and "True". I hope that is the information you needed from that tool. Thank you.
Comment 4: Hi Tina, Not necessarily. And I am afraid you need to have a good understanding of how the recordings are managed in the BBB server. Are you doing the getRecording request for the specific meeting you are looking for? The BigBluebuttonBN plugin will show you only the recordings related to the BigBlueButtonBN activities in the course it is. If there are recordings in the BBB server from other courses you will see them by using the getRecordings command, but they don't necessarily belong to the course where you have the recordingsBN instance. You need to execute the query for the specific meetingID you are looking for. You can see that ID if you launch into a session from your moodle and while you are in you run a getMeetings command using apimate Take that ID and use it to recover the recordings. If after the recording is made you have recordings in the recordings element, so all is good. NExt thing to look at is the connectivity between your Moodle server and the BBB server The response is always an XML file like this <response><returncode>SUCCESS</returncode><recordings/><messageKey>noRecordings</messageKey><message>There are not recordings for the meetings</message></response> If there is success and no recordings. Well there are just no recordings. If there is success and there are recordings, in the element recordings you should see something like this for each recording in that server: 
```text
<recording>
   <recordID>26961dd06cd95364e5fc58cdb3e69837609b59ee-1414094627549</recordID>
   <meetingID>3c9da89e522728730c41bd16c82624d4-2-1</meetingID>
   <name>BBB Test</name>
   <published>true</published>
   <startTime>1414094627000</startTime>
   <endTime>1414095020000</endTime>
   <
metadata
>
      <originservername>192.168.22.147</originservername>
      <contextactivitydescription>Test</contextactivitydescription>
      <contextactivity>BBB Test</contextactivity>
      <origin>Moodle</origin>
      <recording>true</recording>
      <
context
>English 101</context>
      <originversion>2.7 (Build: 20140512)</originversion>
      <originservercommonname />
      <origintag>moodle-mod_bigbluebuttonbn (2014101002)</origintag>
   </metadata>
   <playback>
      <format>
         <type>presentation</type>
         <url>http://ANYURL/presentation</url>
         <length>7</length>
      </format>
   </playback>
</recording>
```
 
```text

```
 
```text

```
 You are looking for the recording for an specific meetingID that belongs to the activity you created in your moodle <meetingID>3c9da89e522728730c41bd16c82624d4-2-1</meetingID>

Post title: OpenMeetings recordings management
Post description: How does one manage Recordings made with Openmeetings plugin? Right now as far as I can see:

1) Every recording is accessible to be added in every course (?)
2) They can not be renamed or deleted at all (?????)

Using Moodle 2.6.2 and OM plugin 1.7.

Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, 1) yes, at the moment every om recording made via moodle is accessible to be added in every course, 2) yes, at the moment the recordings can't be renamed or deleted via moodle, only the om administrator can delete the recordings. Greetings, Michael Wuttke
Comment 2: 1) Is there some way to fix this? I don't think it's good to have every recording available in every course, especially when the number of them grows. (It actually would be nice to be able to set a filename of recording...) 2) How exactly OM administrator can delete the recordings? When I go into OM admin panel, to the "Recordings" tab, there are no recordings there, even though I see them in a list in Moodle when creating a new OM activity.
Comment 3: Hello, 1) I'm agree with you that the om moodle plugin needs some improvements in this case, probably the OM server it self also. But I'm not able to make it at the moment. 2) if I'm not mistaken, via the GUI as an OM admin you can change the settings of a OM room/recording created by moodle from not public to public and than you are able to see and delete the recordings as OM admin. But don't delete the recordings directly at the database level. Thanks & Greetings, Michael
Comment 4: > if I'm not mistaken, via the GUI as an OM admin you can change the
settings of a OM room/recording created by moodle from not public to
public I think you are mistaken, because I can not find any access to any of the recordings made from moodle in openmeetings admin interface.
Comment 5: Hello, this problem will still be discussed in the openmeetings user list. At the moment there is no simple solution for the problem you described. Maybe you can follow the thread in this user mailing list . Thanks & Greatings, Michael

Post title: restricting user access in folders
Post description: HI all I want to establish a topic that all designated users  (Students and supervisors) can access but within that topic, I would like individual FOLDERS which contain exam results that only the student, supervsior and manager can see.  Is it possible to have wider access to a topic, but restrict access to folders within the topic?  And to have different user access (Individuals)  for each folder?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You need to investigate groups and groupings. Put your users - students/supervisors/managers into separate groups and then put them each into a grouping . Then allocate one folder to a one grouping/another to another and so on. Not sure if you are using 1.9 or 2.o but here is a videothat explains it and there is also documentation here Groupings
Comment 2: Thanks for the reply, mary.  To clarify, I have 35 students, each with 2 teachers. I want 35 different folders, each with access ( and ability to upload docs etc) by the 3 , but not to be able to see any other folder.
Comment 3: Hi Kerrie, I have the same need, do you figured out how to do this? I need to upload a private file for each student. Thanks.

Post title: OpenMeetings not working
Post description: I have added Openmeetings plugin in my moodle 2.7. When I tried to add that as an activity, I am getting the error 'openmeetings service failed and no response was returned' . Please help me.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Santhosh, Because of the error message you posted, please make sure that curl is
installed on your moodle server and is activated. And please have also a
look in to the apache log files - to ensure curl is able to reach your
Openmeetings server and is able to send a request. And please make sure that the ports 5080 and 1935 are available on your Openmeetings Server. BTW : What version of openmeetings moodle plugin and what version of OM Server you are using? Thanks & Greetings, Michael

Comment 2: Hi Faisal, Thanks for the feedback. I just noticed the issue the last night in one of our servers. Comment 4: Hi Jesus Thanks for the update. Is there a way to try this version without affecting the recorded sessions. Or let me ask a general question. Comment 5: Hi Jesus Further to my previous message I tried release 2014101001 on a test server and it worked. Now I want to know how to upgrade from 2014070401 in the production server without affecting the recordings of the past sessions. Any suggestions on this please? Best Regards Faisal
Comment 6: You can just update. No need to remove any of the previous versions. And actually, DON'T DO IT!. As you pointed, if you remove the current plugin the database tables will be deleted so you will lose not only the activities in all your courses but also the references to all the recordings.
Comment 7: The update shluld be done as for any other plugin. Just replace the content in the directory /your moodle location/mod/bigbluebuttonbn With the one in the new package. Then as administrator you go to notifications and click the button update database. If you are in a production server it is always sound to make a backup of your database

Post title: BigBlueButton: Viewers join with Listen Only
Post description: We would like to configure BBB so that when a viewer joins they join with Listen Only automatically (without being prompt to choose between Microphone or Listen Only) We want to avoid creating an audio channel in FreeSWITCH for every user and increasing the CPU load, when they only have to listen. (Moderators of course still have the option, because they will be leading the session) Can we make this change via the Moodle plugin or do we have to make the change on the BBB server ? (config. xml ?)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: As you stated it, the only way is to use a config.xml for each of the two roles. Unfortunately the current version of the BigBlueButtonBN plugin does not support the use of BBB dynamic config.xml. You would need to implement it making the changes to the Moodle plugin. There are some examples you can use, but they are in Java http://demo.bigbluebutton.org/demo/demo12.jsp And the documentation for this API feature is here https://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/API

Forum Post: 
Post title: Server Specs - BigBlueButton
Post description: Looking for opinions!! I have been running BBB on a server that does not meet even the minimum specs.  (2.0GHz Dual Core, 4GB RAM, 350GB Hard Drive) I ran it for testing purposes, the most I would ever have connect is 20, before I would see the load begin to be too high. The test has been successful, and now I want to go live with a new server.   I know I want to be above the minimum specs I hope to have up to 100 users on at a time.  I hope to find out what others are running their BBB on and how many users are on it Mike
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Mike, Per usual with this type of system and deployment - your specific environment and the setups of your students will have a significant impact on how everything performs. Most of the time our server is in use it has between 30-70 concurrent users. We maxed it out at 124 - once. It worked, but I did notice some mildly degraded audio, especially in the recording. Based on monitoring, we believe that was more a function of running into bandwidth limits (on our client side) rather than pushing the server to any sort of limits. We have a fully virtualized infrastructure - for production systems we make sure we slightly under-provision the underlying hardware. Our BBB installation is running with 8 cores (the underlying system is 2.3GH Xeons) and 16GB of RAM. The filesystem is running on a flash-based subsystem.
Comment 2: Thank you for your response. This gives me an idea on what I need to present to the powers that be.  I am really going to try to limit who can use this.  We are heavily virtualized, but I think I want to keep a stand alone server for BigBlueButton.  I am going to attempt to limit who can use it. Once again, thank you. Mike

add_to_log() has been deprecated, please rewrite your code to the new events API
  • line 48 of /lib/deprecatedlib.php: call to debugging()
  • line 52 of /mod/bigbluebuttonbn/view.php: call to add_to_log()
can you help me to fix this thank you Comments associated with the post: Comment 1: Join the crowd. Just press that big blue button and it will work is just an illusion. Are you the admin? Because that is the person who has to do all the setting up. I do believe there is a long list of instructions on how to install this first. If you are a windows user you you could install first Oracle vm virtualbox, and then download a ubuntu 10.04 server, and then the fun begins on installing bigbluebutton. Its a bit like installing your own moodle. Try here http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/BigBlueButton As I said, you need to be the admin. Comment 2: Thanks for the reply. I'm an admin we installed the server with this instructions: https://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/BigBlueButtonVM I guess we didn't allow the ports instead of 80. I'll do it and we will see if it's helping. I hope this is the only issue Comment 3: If you get that error either your Moodle server doesn't have access to the BigBlueButton server or the BigBlueButton server you are using is not working properly (so the response sent to the Moodle server is not correct). You don't need to install your own BigBlueButton server to test it. You can use the default values and create/use meetings as it is shown in the video included in the plugin page https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=mod_bigbluebuttonbn Just keep in mind that your Moodle server needs to be able to communicate with the bigbluebutton server using CURL. The first call the plugin makes is to validate the BBB version parsing the xml response that you usually get from here http://test-install.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/api/ Also, as always, the more information you provide (specially versions you are using, settings you have and steps you followed), the easier for anyone to help you out. Regards, Comment 4: Hey thanks for the reply when I set the " http://test-install.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/ " url in moodle bbb setting it does work. but of course we want it to work on our bbb server. the IP from the bbb virtual machine is 10.0.9.92 (internal network -it's ok) so I set the url setting like this: " 10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/"  and here again I have the error I described in the beginning of this post. when clicking on the link you provided this is the output: This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below. SUCCESS 0.81 More information: THE bbb server runs under windows in a vmware player installed and downloaded from here . I turned off the bbb server firewall , but still same problem. if there are more questions please let me know and what can I do now? Thanks Thansk Comment 5: Hi Miki, If the configuration by default works so the plugin and the moodle server configuration are correct. So there are a few things you may want to check: First. By chance, are you missing the protocol in the url? >url setting like this: " 10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/" It should be http://10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/ , if that is the url you use to access to your BBB server, which by the way, assuming you have a n standard and complete installation, it should show you the demo page. Also, if you test this URL in your browser http://10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/api/ do you get the same XMl you got from the test-install server? You should. If you don't so your BBB server is broken. And finally, did you replace the salt (AKA shared secret) by default with the one used by your server? The one that comes by default only works for test-install, at least you replace the salt in your BBB server. By the way, the XML response you got in the browser has nothing to do with the response your Moodle server should get. That only means that your client computer can communicate with the BBB server, but doesn't mean the Moodle server can. JF Comment 6: Hay again thanks for the info. 1) in the moodle setting I set with http:// and without and it was the same error. 2) When clicking ( in the browser) on http://10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/api/ I get: " This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below. SUCCESS 0.81 " 3) Well when I'm clicking in the browser on this link: (with or without "http://") "10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/" I get this: This page is no longer available, please use the api." What does it mean? 4)but the default demo in the server works find namely only clinking in the browser on the ip 10.0.9.92 I get the bbb app (where I can log in and enter my name...) 5) About the salt.  unfortunately I forgot   (didn't notice) I need to change it. where is the salt key in the vmware so I can copy paste it to the moodle setting? Thanks again for the help. Comment 7: Hi Miki, So, as I imagined you have a configuration issue. As this is your first experience with BigBlueButton, you will find very useful information here https://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/FAQ If you want to change the salt go directly here https://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/FAQ#How_do_I_change_the_security_salt? This will help you to do basic administration on your BBB server https://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/BBBConf You are specifically looking for this command bbb-conf --salt Good luck! JF Or if you only want to see the information of your server Comment 8: I was getting a similar error. I knew the mapping and SALT were correct. I ran sudo bbb-conf --clean   on the BBB server that all was it needed. Comment 9: Hi Mike, Thanks for sharing your experience. You can also try restarting the server but you should not really need it for diagnosis. The first thing you want to try is of course to make sure that the target BBB server is working fine using the demo page installed by default. When you are trying to make the plugin to work for the very first time, we recommend testing with the configuration by default. If that works you can discard a bunch of things. If these two conditions are fulfilled, then you can proceed with changing the URL and SALT. Now, if after these three steps you still have problems, the first thing I would check is communication between servers. Making a wget call from the Moodle server to the BBB server can give you a good idea about what can be possible wrong. ```text wget -O - http://demo.bigbluebutton.org/bigbluebutton/api ``` Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Web Conferencing for Free or Almost Free...
Post description: I have a small group of students that I conference with so I don't want to pay some host $50 per month.  I find that Adobe Connect, BBB, Elluminate, and OpenMeetings only make sense if you have an expensive server and large bandwidth.  What if you are just meeting with a few students? Join.Me - https://join.me/ - Free - Supported by LogMeIn company.  You install a very small exe on your machine and I've have broadcasted my desktop up to 20 people at the same time. You can allow any of them to control your desktop, it's super easy to chat and send files. Pros: Free Broadcasts desktop up to 20 people with high quality. Can transfer files between host and participants. Participants don't need to install ANY software. Cons: No VOIP - you'll need Skype or something else. No Webcam support Need to install a small piece of software to start. They just need a flash enabled browser. Can't "trade" desktop views. Yvew http://vyew.com/s/ - Shares a whiteboard with everyone. Free up to 10 participantss.  Yvew even has a table explaining why Yvew is better than Adobe Connect and WebEx. ( http://vyew.com/site/product/comparison ) Pros: Free (Up to 10 people) Saves your sessions so that people can go back and review. People can easily share pictures, documents, videos. Can make breakout rooms and subchat rooms. Webcam and Audio Support Many Administrator features.. you can give people moderator access if you want. Can share desktops (not tested) Cons: All clients need a flash browser. Video quality of webcam poor compared to Skype. Audio is not as good as well.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Skype - Free PROS: Free Best audio and webcam quality on the internet.  (Better than Big Blue Button, Adobe Connect, illuminate. Works on Linux, OSX, Windows CONS: Students can't drop in on a conference call after it's started. You have to shut down the entire call and recall everyone Desktop sharing is terrible blurry quality. You also can't control their desktop at all or point at items.
Comment 2: As one of the developers of CliqMeet ( https://www.cliqmeet.com ) i would like to share this tool. IMHO : Pros: Free for non commercialized usage, deveoped by a german university startup at the TU Munich Mostly HTML5 (Powered by Node.JS and Websockets, Ready for WebRTC as soon most browsers support it) Share PDF-Presentations, Whiteboard, Files, Watch Videos together, Text Editor, etc Webcam and Audio Support, record your sessions, support for mobile devices by Live-Streaming Widget-Based organization of room with layouts Can share desktop with Teamviewer and Java Cons: Beta, english language 90% supported, you will need a modern browser Please tell us! Give it a try, we would love to get some feedback.
Comment 3: Another very good option is RHUB. Its web conferencing servers are easy to use and best part is, it has no download of any kind.

Post title: BBB Recording Resource error
Post description: Moodle 2.7, Latest BBB.  PHP 5.3, using the test side with no changes to installation steps. Works fine until I Create a 'resource =Recordings BN' eg. Class Sessions.  When I click on Class Sessions I get Internal Server Error - The server encountered an internal error or misconfiguration and was unable to complete your request. ...and also says "404 Not Found". I do not know what to do.  Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I solved this myself.  I will share in case it happens to someone else. My server is running php handler suphp. Maximum file permission should be 644 and for folders you can have maximum permission 755. In this case I changed the permission of folder  to 755 and this fixed the problem.

Post title: PLEASE HELP: Adobe Hosted Connect in MoodleRooms??
Post description: My problem is that our Adobe Connect developers may have some outdated information: they're telling us that that when the Connect plugin was first developed in MoodleRooms, colleges had to have an "on-premise" hosted version of Connect... a $40k investment. However MoodleRooms Tech Support states that "you can either host it yourself or subscribe to another Adobe Connect hosting service.", giving us the impression that the MoodleRooms plugin will work with any environment that Adobe Connect is hosted in, including "Adobe hosted Connect" as mentioned in http://www.adobe.com/products/adobeconnect/buying-guide.html . We can not afford to make a $40k investment in an on-premise hosted version, but we can do an Adobe hosted Connect. I understand that MoodleRooms is only responsible for turning on the Connect plugin, but we need help! Please can anyone confirm for me and our developers that the MoodleRooms plugin for Connect will work with an "Adobe hosted Connect" that we activate through Adobe, and that we wouldn't have to have Connect hosted "on-premise"? Thank you very much!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Pedram, To start the plugin you refer to as the Moodlerooms Adobe connect plugin is not the name of the plugin the Moodle  community would understand. If you are looking for community feedback you are asking about the Adobe Connect community plugin found at https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=mod_adobeconnect . This is the plugin Moodlerooms has reviewed and is available for clients to enable. Historically this plugin will work with hosted adobe connect sites except for the single sign on. This plugin focuses on adobe connect pro, which is an on premise solution, and this is historically the only server type that the plugin supports single sign on for.

Post title: Moodle With best web conference solution
Post description: I am working on a solution where we can provide e-learning platform along with web conference solution in which virtual classes can be conducted (audio + video). We are looking for an open source solution with bare minimum expenses as this will be a non-profit solution in the begining phase. We also want to integrate payment processors to collect any voluntary contributions through credit cards, paypal and alertpay. Can someone please guide us in the right direction along with all possible download links for applications & plugins. Your assistance and guidance will be highly appreciated. Jason
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Have you done a search for Big Blue Button?
Comment 2: Thanks for your reply. Well yes I have tried the demo etc. But instead of trying all the solutions and delays, I was wondering I can get good suggesstions from those who have successfully installed and launch successfully a LMS network. So BigBlueButton the most popular platform to integrate with Moodle ?
Comment 3: We've been playing around with various webinar options for several years, going back to the heyday of DimDim when it seemed like it might actually be an opensource alternative to Adobe. After several years and various solutions we're waiting for BigBlueButton to reach 0.8. I really believe that BigBlueButton is the best cost effective solution. If you have the money and infrastructure for an on-site version of Adobe Connect then I hear the integrations with Moodle are pretty good, but it's not a good solution if you don't have a dedicated installation of Connect under the control of the same group that runs your LMS. BigBlueButton meets almost all of our needs right now, but for us to really commit to it we need recording and playback, which should drop in the next few weeks. At that point we'll re-evaluate moving completely over to an integrated installation of BigBlueButton. Right now we make due with a mix of a few other solutions and upload the recordings after the fact to our instance of Kaltura CE.
Comment 4: So let me see if I understood you correctly, currently there is no open source web conference module or plugin for moodle that have capabilities to record audio and video on techer's hard drive to allow to upload the files manually into moodle at a later time ? We have our own dedicated server . Along with moodle, what web conference application we should install (open source not adobe) with moodle that will provide us audio and video recordings, does not matter if we have to upload these manully into moodle at a later time. Also we want to be able to set permissions on student's access like which class can be accessed by certain students and what material can be accessed by which student.
Comment 5: At the moment BigBlueButton (version 0.71) doesn't support recording and playback at all. Theoretically you could use screen capture software to record a session and manually upload the recordings after the fact, but we decided that such a solution was too cumbersome for day-to-day use. Currently, we're using two separate commercial webinar products (we serve two populations) that we don't have integrated with Moodle at all and we upload the recordings to our archive courses on Moodle manually. Our preference is for an integrated solution and we hope that the release of BigBlueButton 0.8 will make that possible, but I'm not sure since 0.8 hasn't been released yet.
Comment 6: I wanted to use BigBlueButton but they are not currently planning to release breakout rooms anytime soon.  I am not sure if the Moodle/Adobe integrations includes the breakout functionality or how to anticipate the pricing for a moodle user. Are you aware of another web conferencing tool that integrates nicely with Moodle and offers audio enabled breakout rooms? Do you know how I can develop a budget for an Adobe solution?
Comment 7: You can use various web conferencing services such as webex.com, gomeetnow.com, gotomeeting.com in order to deliver trainings online.
Comment 8: Open source solution will deliver what you pay for. I would recommend using paid services such as RHUB web conferencing appliances, WebEx, gotomeeting etc. as quality of audio - video is very important for conducting e-learning classes.
Comment 9: > Open source solution will deliver what you pay for. I would say Moodle offers an excellent open source solution for a LMS. Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer
Comment 10: Thank you for the reply.  I was hoping someone would already know of a web-conferencing plugin that has audio enabled break out rooms, like Abobe.  I wanted to go with BigBlueButton but there are no current plans to offer breakout rooms.  Thank you
Comment 11: We use Blackboard Collaborate Web Conferencing (formerly "Elluminate Live!", a solution with audio enabled breakout rooms. I did not contribute earlier, because our classroom solution is not open-source. After Blackboard acquired Elluminate some years ago, the famous Moodle bridge plugin disappeared from Moodle Docs Plugin directory. The Elluminate trainer community did wait in vain, how Blackboard, (who is vendor of a commercial LMS also) will handle Elluminate´s Moodle connectivity in the future. Here are the good news: Blackboard did continue to integrate the famous Elluminate engine, now named "Collaborate Web Conferencing" with many LMS (especially all those supporting the LTI standard). Collaborate´s user interface is improved from Elluminate´s plane cockpit GUI, The Java -based engine is still the same and does include audio-enabled breakout-rooms as usual However, recording and playback of actions happening in several breakout rooms might be difficult to handle, several independant audio streams in parallel. It might be a better idea to define several rooms and let participant change the room for group work. This enables you to record each room independantly. Collaborate has a flatrate-like license model limiting the number of seats, but not number of rooms driven in parallel. The dedicated Collaborate-Moodle Integation is currently certified for Moodle up to 2.5x . I´m driving the Collaborate plugin v3.1 on my Moodle 2.6 - without glitches up to now. Please note, that Collaborate´s Moodle plugin is distributed by vendor only and therefore not listed in the Moodle Docs plugin directory. I currently consider this as a conceptual bug of the Moodle Docs site disallowing any documentation about plugins not being distributed there.
