Post title: DimDim or Elluminate?
Post description: Hello, What a quandry.....any opinions of DimDim vs Elluminate ?  I keep bouncing between the two.  For the moment, I just want to use it for small meetings of less than 5 people, but I would like to be able to record the events.  I am not keen on paying a per month charge though.  Even so, what are you ideas? Thanks for the participation! Dave
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Try OpenMeetings. Cheap, easy to use. Well featured.
Comment 2: Hello Dave! I have got maybe an other suggestion for you! OpenMeetings You can record, screensharing, whiteboard, everything you need and it is very easy to handle for users and administrator! Just check out the youtube video from Sebastian Wagner, he is the developer of OpenMeetings! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5a7-HFm8Ghs For more infos just contact him! seba.wagner@gmail.com
Comment 3: or wiziq live class module: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=1113&filter=1 Regards, Heidi
Comment 4: One that we are using and is VERY easy to setup is called Big Blue Button.
Comment 5: I have just started looking into web conferencing. I have used elluminate. It's expensive but it works. I am interested in trying out the BigBlueButton . ( http://bigbluebutton.org/ ) It looks like it has most of the functions that I would need. I never really liked the record features of elluminate simply because I never really wanted to watch long meetings again. However, If you invest $299 in Camtasia studio ( http://www.techsmith.com/camtasia/ ), you can record meetings and then cut out the fluff later. There are some free alternative desktop recording options, but Camtasia is, by far, the best out there. I actually use Camtasia a lot to create training videos and lectures. It would be nice if a web-conferencing programs also allowed the recording and editing features that you find in Camtasia. I have also used Camtasia to record someone else's elluminate meeting. It was a good thing since they forgot to hit record at first and then later realized their voice wasn't being recorded. As of this reply, BigBlueButton was still working out some kinks on their whiteboard feature. However, a good, free whiteboard application/website is scribblar.com . ( http://www.scribblar.com/ ) It allows you to create multiple rooms and each room allows multiple pages. It even allows file sharing and pdf uploads of 5 pages. I have used scribblar for lecture rooms in moodle as well as tutoring rooms. I love the fact that you just have to put a link to the room in the moodle course for others to access the whiteboard. It also allows you to lock the room so that others cannot change or delete things if you have a lesson set up or something. It doesn't have a record feature, but again you can use Camtasia to record a session and post it to YouTube or something later. So, my recommendation would be to use 3 programs: BigBlueButton - although I have only seen demos at this point (But it does have a moodle module.) Scribblar - Easy, powerful, and free whiteboard Camtasia - $299, but well worth the money. You will thank yourself for buying a copy.
Comment 6: If Camtasia Studio works than CamStudio should work too. You can find it free at http://camstudio.org/ Also have a look at WIZIQ I use it and it works!
Comment 7: http://me.tokbox.com might also be another option if you just want a simple VC capability...? Stu
Comment 8: Hi there, Another possibility is Zorap : not integrated with Moodle, no recordings or moderation but free and seems to work as well as Skype. Have only tested with 5 participants. Cheers, Glenys
Comment 9: There is also OpenMeetings it has a module for Moodle. The down side to most of the conferencing software is either a browser without cookies or no browser built in. John
Comment 10: Some of the current webconferencing modules look like they are simply interfaces to access commercial services. For the whole community, the ideal way to go is probably to keep a free open source version (based on version 4.5) of a Dimdim module up to date and glitch free. It might also be helpful to change the name to separate it from its Dimdim past. (No pun intended.) I'd suggest that it's important to have the range of features that people want, but keep the possiblility of switching off features that administrators don't want to provide, as some features won't be appropriate for some student groups. If it's good enough, it would eventually get drawn into the mainstream Moodle. CamStudio is also open source and it might be possible to integrate it to add features. Might all be easier said than done, but it looks like webconferencing is here to stay, so why wouldn't you/we? Ross W
Comment 11: Just had a look at the details on the Dimdim module for Moodle. Not very impressive at all. Seems to be something quite separate that one has to mess about with to run as part of Moodle. Really needs to integrate much better and more automatically. Ross
Comment 12: It seems that Dimdim may be a waining star.  There was some chatter and talk of a revamp a few weeks ago.   As for Elluminate that got purchased by Wamba mid year.  Wamba also own Blackboard.  Need I type more? Have a look at OpenMeetings or Big Blue Button, both are open source.  I know Openmeeting integrates nicely into Moodle 1.9* as I am using it. John
Comment 13: John, Sounds good. Thanks for the tip. Dimdim got itself some bad press at one stage, and would need fixing and/or updating to be a major player. What I said about having something like that, which eventually gets integrated into Moodle still seems to be the direction of evolution. Ross
Comment 14: hi John, We've been looking at both BigBlueButton (which is promising but still immature) and the leading commercial solutions (notably Adobe Connect). What level of integration are you describing or envisaging? At this stage, any of these solutions are going to require that you (a) set up an account with a hosted provider or install the solution in your environment alongside Moodle and (b) enable and configure a plugin in Moodle so that it can use that system. Do you imagine it working some other way? Myles
Comment 15: When I first started looking at the whole software issue I set some critera. Moodle fitted the bill like a glove.  Open Source, not to rigid, well documented.  Peer support. Openmeetings is in keeping with critera. Openmeetings is embedded in the Moodle page, so you you don't have to leave your tools such as student notes behind. Module install and config is easy.  OM uses Moodle user info for SSO.  Sometimes a product comes along that just fits and works, OM is it. John
Comment 16: I run BigBlueButton on my moodle and it does prety well....yes you are right; there is still room for improvement. But the latest release 0.71 has some good improvement....especially on voice!
Comment 17: Can you integrate BBB 0.71 to Moodle? In my experience the Dualcode last plugin is for BBB0.70 and it didin't work with the last version.  BBB 0.71 is very good, we realy like it... we use to love Dimdim 4.5 Liberty, but the abandone the open source version and rejecting al community around it.
Comment 18: no trouble at all migrating (done 2 days ago) from 0.70 to 0.71 using the VMs distributed from the website and my Moodle 1.9.8+ with dualcode plugin. Where you are getting errors in 0.71 ?
Comment 19: @Alan Yes you can; i am using mine with it. Same plugin that i used for 0.70 still works flawless with 0.71. What were the chanllenges you had when you tried using it with 0.71?
Comment 20: thanks for the advice. I supose it was a pluggin problem. It was a salt problem. I will try to use the same salt (in a clean install) then i use the: bbb-conf --salt 12345ee... command, . In my case it don't change the salt in: 
```text
/var/lib/tomcat6/webapps/bigbluebutton/demo/bbb_api_conf.jsp
```
 http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/BigBlueButton#Changing_the_BBB_security_salt Thanks Again.
Comment 21: Did you use "sudo bbb-conf ...." or execute it as root and not as firstuser user ?
I did the same mistake twice...
Comment 22: @Alan incase you have not sorted this out; yes you are right that bbb-config --saltset <salt> does change the demo api but note that the salt at /var/lib/tomcat6/webapps/bigbluebutton/demo/bbb_api_conf.jsp is for the demo page, if that did not change, then it should not affect you moodle api, it will only affect your demo page. You need to verify that the salt at "cat /var/lib/tomcat6/webapps/bigbluebutton/WEB-INF/classes/bigbluebutton.properties" is the same as that of your moodle API. cheers
Comment 23: I have long advocated that Moodle needs a voice.   With some courses VoIP is enough, others we need the Full Monty.   Openmeetings allows us to keep it in-house, data is cheap. The model we use gives up a good edge with primary and high schoolers. John
Comment 24: The marketing policy of DimDim has not been open at all. They initially talked a lot about open source nature. Then they started delaying the open source releases and got into open source crippleware (no recording feature for example in open source). Now, the delay in open source update is simply too much. In fact, DimDim has most likely used the free word of mouth publicity associated with open source product as a stepping stone. Every company has to make money, but if they could be open right from the beginning about their policy, it would have helped. If one was interested in open source only, one would possibly not have wasted time on DimDim. Having said that, DimDim product looks okay to me for basic web conferencing and scores on ease of use. But, the free version gradually is being marginalised and if you use the free version, you notice how much shout is there about upgrade.
Comment 25: Yes, everything seems to indicate that Dimdim has committed suicide in small increments. Whatever we have should be a simple install and otherwise seamless, as long as you have the right hardware. I really would like to avoid separately setting up an account with a hosted provider or going through a complicated install / configure. Too complicated and too much to go wrong. Ross
Comment 26: During the last three year we experienced many web-conferencing tools. The last choice is Adobe Connect for serious (and paying) courses, and BigBlueButton for experiment and free access to a webconf tool. We installed also OpenMeetings but it's too unusable, many crash, restart and so on (client side....) ; this is our opinion but from two months ago OM was dismissed and BBB has taken it's place. I don't know elluminate but dimdim was analyzed and not considered as a real commercial choice against AdobeConnect. Hope this helps
Comment 27: DimDim is no longer available. In addition to Elluminate, one can even consider deploying on premise RHUB web conferencing appliances for conducting online meetings.

Post title: BigBlueButton 0.81-RC released
Post description: We are pleased to announce the availability of a release candidate (RC) for BigBlueButton 0.81 , our eleventh release to date. A release candidate for BigBlueButton means all development is finished, all testing is done, and the only remaining task is to change the label from 0.81-RC to 0.81. Our goal for each release of BigBlueButton is to advance the project in stability, usability , and core features.  A release candidate is the final stage of our development process. Want to give a BIG THANKS to everyone who used an earlier version of 0.81, given us feedback, submitted a bug request, sent us a pull request, or posted or tweeted about our project. For more information, and links to download /upgrade, see release notes . Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer

Forum Post: 
Post title: Connect-to-Moodle
Post description: Hi Folks, I'm up-to-date with the discussion about the Remote Learner Adobe Connect plugin for moodle here: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=145225 , particularly in regard to the inability to connect to a hosted adobe solution with SSO. I've just noticed on the adobe site another plugin for use with adobe connect and moodle: http://www.adobe.com/uk/products/adobeconnect/feature-details/connect-moodle.html Does anyone have any experience with this mod? http://www.refineddata.com/learning-management/c2m I can't see any reviews for it, or any mentions of it in moodle.org forums. What is of interest is the money-line: Connect-to-Moodle provides a Single Sign On (SSO) environment in which information passes effortlessly in both directions between the two platforms so users cannot tell where Moodle ends and Adobe Connect begins. The SSO associated with the free integrator doesn't work with Adobe Hosted Solutions (majority of Adobe deployments). I wonder how they have achieved this with: " Connect-to-Moodle is installed as a series of simple drop-in modules, blocks and activities . ", when the discussion on the remote leaner plugin points to adobe being the problem for SSO on hosted solutions? Has anyone had any experience with this mod? Would anyone from Remote Learner like to comment? Cheers, -David

Forum Post: 
Post title: BBB - Multiple meetings / scheduled mettings
Post description: I have a client who uses continuous enrolment and needs to run meetings as a "days after enrolment" type schedule. They have worked out a complex system of dates for when different levels of enrolment would be available for the next virtual meeting. Think of it like this: Day 1 : User 1,2 & 3 enrol Day 25: User 4 & 5 enrol Day 30 : Users 1, 2 & 3 do their first scheduled meeting over BBB, share files, do video conferences, that stuff. (Not recorded or assessed) Day 45: More users enrol Day 55 : Users 4 & 5 do their first scheduled meeting Day 60 : Users 1, 2 & 3 have their second scheduled meeting, which is recorded and assessed. etc ... We don't know the calendar dates of "day N", except by counting them out. Days after enrolment type scheduling is a pain, but that's the job. Our second problem is that BBB seems to have a "single activity = single meeting" association. So over time, the course is going to have a stack of use-once-then-discard activities , which is something I'd like to avoid. I'd like to know if there's a way to modify the plugin for moodle (or if there is an existing plugin) that allows multiple schedules for a single activity.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Disable camera/audio pop up box
Post description: Hi, When BBB is started it pops up a flash box, asking if camera/audio sharing is allowd, and if the user wants to join the audio session, is it possible I disable this box and just allow camera/audio by default. Thanks, Paul
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Paul, It is not possible to disable this security dialog. There is no one-way only audio in BigBlueButton.  When a user joins the audio session, the BigBlueButton client creates a two-way audio bridge. The moderator can set all users to join muted, but the underlying audio channel is still two-way, hence the need for the security dialog to request the user's permission for access to webcam and microphone. Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer

Post title: Big Blue Button on Shared Server
Post description: I cant seem to load the BBB on Moodle it keeps showing Logging in as moderator ... Please i need all the help i can get thanks I Installed BBB by extracting the plugins into the mod folder in my server I had to use this method because i am using a shared server
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Yusuf, The role of the user when entering BigBlueButton (moderator or viewer) depends on the user's role in Moodle. If they are a student, they will enter the BigBlueButton session as viewer. If they have any other privliges in Moodle beyond student, they will enter BigBlueButton as a moderator. Your probably testing the plugin when logged into your Moodle site as administrator, which is why you are always entering the BigBlueButton session as moderator. Try logging into your Moodle site as a student and enter the BigBlueButton session.  You should join as a viewer. Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodleand Big Blue Button on different servers
Post description: I am trying to integrate Big Blue Button with Moodle, the BBB readme file says that Moodle & Big Blue Button need to be on different servers? Is there any reason for this requirement? Thanks, Paul
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: We recommend two different servers mainly due performance but also because it makes easier the administration. Off course if you have a big server and only few users, you could handle the two services in the same box. Just keep in mind that out of the box BigBlueButton has a web server (nginx) configured to listen the port 80 (as any other web server has by default). You can deal with the configuration of moodle on nginx or if you want to install a different webserver like apache, you would need to put either of them to listen to a different por, hence to do extra configuration. We as BigBlueButton developers and commercial providers never do that, not even for development, but yes, we have learn of several deployments of both services in one box. So, the use of two servers is highly recommended but it's not mandatorily required. Regards Jesus Federico
Comment 2: Good reply Jesus. Paul, see also this FAQ entry: http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/FAQ#We_recommend_running_BigBlueButton_on_port_80 Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer
Comment 3: Thanks guys, the information is very helpful!

Forum Post: 
Post title: BBB Attendance Report in Moodle
Post description: Reporting "attendance" is one of the selection requirements for a webconferencing software. How is the specific Moodle-initiated BBB session identified to the BBB server ? Is is accessed via a get URL ? If so, to get the start and end time of a participant, two details could be added to that URL : an "entry url" and an "exit url". When the BBB server does a successful get on the entry url, it sends "time of entry" to the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_log table. When the user exits the session (e.g., via logging out or losing the connection for whatever reason) the BBB server does a get on the exit url and sends the "time of exit" to the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_log table. Does that make sense?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Yes, that is the only implementation that could be done by now, but anyway the report would not be 100% reliable.

The exceptions for the use case you are proposing are when the users close the tab or browser, or when the communication fails and the user get disconnected.

There is no problem with joining time, but with the leaving time.

Regards,

Jesus Federico

Post title: BigBlueButtonBN activity module 1.0.8-b2 just released
Post description: I want to announce that as part of the efforts for having a really solid integration of BigBlueButton with Moodle we have just released a new version of the BigBlueButtonBN and RecordingBN modules. This is the 1.0.8-b2 release that has been labeled as version 2012081300 for both components, BigBlueButtonBN and RecordingsBN . The main changes and/or improvements included since the previos release are: 1. The schedule parameters that were originaly activated only for activities in section 1 and higher, are now also available for activities in the section 0. 2. There was a serious security issue on internal calls to index.php, ajax .php and bbb-broker. The access was not validated according to the permissions of the users. This issue was registered as CONTRIB-3840 on the Moodle tracking system. 3. A bug was preventing the normal operation of the module on servers accessing bigbluebutton and external services trhought a proxy server . This bug was registered as CONTRIB-3844 on the Moodle tracking system. These are the issues reported by users during the beta one testing phase. If you find anything that you think is a bug or it can be improved, please don't hesitate in letting us know or directly create an issue on the tracking system for the corresponding project ( BigBlueButtonBN or RecordingsBN )

Post title: OpenMeetings Moodle Mod Version 1.2 and security update with OpenMeetings 1.8.3
Post description: With the new integration and OpenMeetings version 1.8.3 you can now create separated users in OpenMeetings with the access-level "SOAP-Only". The "SOAP-Only" user can do exactly what is needed to run the integration but nothing more. This does result in no need for any OpenMeetings Admin-User in the Moodle Module config! So you can better protect your OpenMeetings server from non-authorized access via the SOAP Gateway and no need to share confidential account data."SOAP-Only" users can not login to OpenMeetings administration or manipulate user accounts via SOAP. It is recommended to update to the latest version of OpenMeetings (1.8.3). Moodle Mod 0.9 for Moodle 1.9.x is still compatible with OpenMeetings 1.8.3 and you can also use the new secure user with access level "SOAP-Only" with the old Moodle Mod 0.9. Sample Video showing the installation of Moodle Mod and integration with new access level: New features of Moodle Plugin : - Secure "SOAP-Only" user access level (see documentation on top) - 3 Moderation Types for Conference Rooms (Moodle admins, teachers and course creators are automatically a moderator): Moderation Type A) Participants need to wait till the teacher enters the room Moderation Type B) Participants can already start (first User in room becomes moderator) Moderation Type C) Every participant is automatically moderator when he/she enters the room - New Flag "Allow Recording": You can set in the room configuration now a flag that controls if the recording button is available or not You can try and test the Moodle integration at: http://moodle.openmeetings.de Download is available from our project side: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/ Support is available at: http://www.openmeetings.de Sebastian

Post title: rtl languages in bigbluebutton
Post description: hello could someone guide me how to enable RTL language in bigbluebutton? the order of letters in which word is correct now, but the order of words is inverted.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Farahnaz, We don't have Right To Left support in BigBlueButton at the moment.  We've had others request this feature and we've got an enhancement request in place for it http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=686 At the moment, we're pretty busy working on BigBlueButton 0.8 (record and playback) and preparing for its upcoming beta release. Once we finish BigBlueButton 0.8, we'll prioritize the features for the next iteration.  To understand how we priorotize the features, see http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/FAQ#When_will_feature_X_be_implemented We definitely want to see RTL support in BigBlueButton.  Implementing RTL would require some rework of the chat interface, along with many other parts of BigBlueButton.  At the moment, we've not investigated the effort, nor can we give any promises on when we can implement this feature. Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer

Post title: Web Conference with Sychronous video
Post description: Hi to all! It seems that after numerous testing projects I will finally try Moodle for real!!! (extremely small scale but still in a "production" environment). The problem is that, apart from asynchronous training, we need to implement some basic web conferencing with (and here is the catch) synchronous video streaming. To illustrate, imagine this scenario: A web conference with 1 instructor and 5 to 10 max participants where the instructor has the ability to present a video (and also pause, rewind etc) which the participants can see in real time over internet (not LAN) in adequate quality and all sides should be able to voice comment on it. Of course, all the web conferencing goodies that, for example, bigbluebutton offers (like whiteboard, raise hands etc.) are more than welcome but not essential. Sharing a Desktop while the video is playing doesn't seem to do the trick since the quality would propably be inadequate. I know I am asking a lot (especially if you consider that it should be a free or low-cost solution at least at the beginning of the project) but I was hoping that someone could suggest a solution or workaround. Thanks in advance, Andreas
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: In order of least to most expensive.  Wiziq and Elluminate.  Wiziq has a mod for Moodle 1.9* and 2. Both will do what you want. John

Post title: OpenMeetings Moodle Mod 1.1 and OpenMeetings 1.7
Post description: We are happy to announce Version 1.1 of the Moodle Mod for OpenMeetings. It fixes that updates to the conference room in Moodle are correctly populated to OpenMeetings. OpenMeetings recently was also updated to Version 1.7 with a number of updates: Multi-Whiteboard, you can add new whiteboard instances, each whiteboard can have the full range of tools and documents inside. Advanced File-Explorer, Drag and Drop Interface for managing files, including possibility to create a document tree with folders. Private and Public Drive in File-Explorer. The File-Explorer has two different views, one is the Private Drive and the other the Public Drive . The Private Drive always contains the same files. Those files are only visible to the user currently loggedin. The Public Drive is bound not to the user, but to the conference room. All users in the conference room have access to the Public Drive. Save whiteboards. You can save each whiteboard instance as a file. The file is located in the File-Explorer and can be drag and drop'ed and organized like any other document, image or folder. New User-Level: SOAP/Web-Service only. For security reasons there is a new user-level. You can now create user-accounts that have only the ability to access via SOAP. In former versions you always need an admin account. MyRooms section. Each user has now by default 2 personal rooms that are always accessible exclusive for that user. There are buttons to enter those rooms from the dashboard VoIP-Integration. Together with our Finish partner and the Open Source Department of Kvarken region we have done a VoIP integration by using an applet for the audio part. For further information see VoIPAndSIP And we've updated out website at: http://www.openmeetings.de Sebastian

Post title: Elluminate Live Module for Moodle 2.0
Post description: Hi, I'm wondering if anybody else that has EL module integrated in their Moodle site has encountered a similar issue when upgrading to Moodle 2.0. We did a test upgrade from M1.9.10 to 2.0.2. We have Elluminate Live module installed in our 1.9, and I was aware that the latest version posted here: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=557&filter=1 is for 1.9, but I just thought to give it a try and drop it in the upgraded Moodle 2.0, and indeed was unsuccessful. I then found out on Elluminate's website that they have a bridge package that supports Moodle 2.0 and is available from their download page . So I got the package and was about to install it, but on the new block/ mod confirmation page I noticed that it's called 'elluminate' now, not 'elluminatelive', thus moodle will treat it as a new install instead of an upgrade. I looked at some of the upgrade  and install scripts in the package, and I think all my data in "mdl_elluminatelive_xxxxxxx" tables will not be transferred, which means that currently scheduled meetings will no longer be there and links to the recordings won't appear on the block. So is there any solution/ workaround/ hint to tackle this. Is the Elluminate Live Module posted in the plugin download page still being supported/ further developed to some extent? thank you, Dimas

Post title: Stream Connect Module
Post description: Hi All We've just completed a new module for adding a series of webcasts to your moodle. This resource is an embedded iframe for a webcast.  The webcast is chosen by the course creator from a list found on an RSS feed.  The location of the RSS feed is global to the site and is set by administrator. CVS = http://cvs.moodle.org/contrib/plugins/blocks/streamconnectsettings/ CVS = http://cvs.moodle.org/contrib/plugins/mod/resource/type/streamconnect/ Bugs = http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB/component/10881 Download = http://cvs.moodle.org/contrib/plugins/blocks/streamconnectsettings.zip Download = http://cvs.moodle.org/contrib/plugins/mod/resource/type/streamconnect.zip You do need an account with Stream Connect to use the plugin  - sales@streamuk.com or 0800 061 2361 This was built by Stream UK in conjunction with Synergy Learning. Best Duncan

Forum Post: 
Post title: OpenMeetings 1.4 and Moodle Plugin Version 0.9
Post description: Hi, we are happy to announce Version 0.9 of the Moodle Plugin and Version 1.4 of OpenMeetings. Version 0.9 of the Moodle Plugin contains a patch to fix the problem with utf8 characters in moodle usernames (which where displayed wrong in OpenMeetings). OpenMeetings 1.4 adds some new features too: New Features: Remote Desktop Control (RDC) in Screen Sharing and separated right for RDC in user list, Moderators are able by default to do RDC other users can apply for it using the right-buttons New separated right for allowing Screen Sharing and Recording Multi- Domain Support: Separated Admin interface for configuring multiple LDAP configurations with a single OpenMeetings Instance, in the Login Box you are able to choose different domains now, each domain represents a LDAP config (you can still use the internal DB all the time, the internal DB is always in the list) New Room features: Close and open conference rooms. Additionally with a redirect- URL in case the room is closed and SOAP Methods to remotely open and close room. Moderators can also close a room from inside the conference room (Menubar: Actions > Close room). Users which are already loggedin will then be redirected to the redirect URL Fix missing attributes in Backup file and add Meeting-Members New Language: Danish, thx to ALO, update Spanish thx to Jesmargo Various small Bugfixes The complete changelog can be found at: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/wiki/ChangeLog Downloads can be retrieved from the project website: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/

Post title: DImDIm 5.5 Beta Test
Post description: The current beta code for testing the DimDim 5.5 plugin can be found here: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-2157 If you want to test: Set up a tracker login Log in to the tracker "Watch" the issue Post the results of your testing to the item NOTE that this is not production code and that prior beta versions have resulted in possible corruption of dbs. Only test in a sandbox. This same code will be used for the "free" DimDim access as well as the Pro access when it is released. In the interim, the 4.5 community integration pack client is still functional if configured correctly. Hopefully, the 5.5 code will be released by the end of July!

Comment 1: At the risk of being facetious.... have you checked the permissions? The directory and all its contents must be readable by the web server . As the rest of your Moodle site works, the easiest thing to do is to make them the same. Check the ownership as well - that should match too. Failing that... you did something wrong installing the module and some or all of the files are missing. Check, for a start, that the version.php file it is complaining about is really there.
Comment 2: Hi, I installed Big blue button only yesterday, no problem with installation and detection. Basically the steps I took was downloading the zip file to a local disk then unzipping it, you may find a biglbluebutton folder inside another bigbluebutton folder. Only one bigbluebutton folder (the inner folder) has to be copied to the mod folder (along with the lang information copied to the lang equivalent folder).
Comment 3: Thanks vijay xtreem, that worked fine. Where, however do I get the Security Salt? I've read the instructions but ????? I'm a dummy.
Comment 4: Are you referring to the password salt. That is a combination of characters-40. The generator can produce it automatically on this moodle.org site. You can add that in your config.php file inside the moodle folder for your website. Its a single line code. Information on settings this up is here: http://docs.moodle.org/en/report/security/report_security_check_passwordsaltmain

Forum Post: 
Post title: About BigBlueButton
Post description: Hi, my college is interested in using this application, does anyone knows if it is working within Moodle? We have Moodle in a hosting service, does this application has any specific Moodle server 's  requirement, besides the bigbluebutton server? Any help will be appreciated. Thanks Carmen
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Carmen. The official Moodle plug-in for BigBlueButton is available here: http://www.dualcode.com/bigbluebutton This plug-in enables communication between your Moodle 1.9.7+ and BigBlueButton server. There are no other specific requirements - it should just work. If you don't have a BBB server setup (or would prefer a hosted solution), the plug-in gives you an option to subscribe to a commercially hosted BBB server, but that is strictly optional. You can point the plug-in to any BBB server you wish. Luc
Comment 2: I have it working. It is by far the best open source web conferencing software I have used. It is very easy to setup and get running too!
Comment 3: Chris, are you archiving (somehow) the conferencing/chats when students are involved?
Comment 4: I echo the above question. We are in the process of testing BBB and will very likely move it into our production instance soon. We would love some form of archiving, but even without it, it is a huge improvement over the (often flaky) chat function currently in Moodle.
Comment 5: There is no current function in BBB to do this. I have chatted with the developers and they say it is part of the roadmap.

Post title: Elluminate Live! integration updated to support server 9.5 / manager 3.0
Post description: Thanks to help from Tanveer Virani at Elluminate, I was able to update the Moodle integration with new code to support the latest release of Elluminate . The code for Moodle version 1.9 was updated and you can download the latest code from the usual place: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=557&filter=1 There are updated installation instructions in the wiki for a brand new 9.5/3.0 install or if you have upgraded from an older version of Elluminate which already had the custom Moodle adapter installed as well. Those specific instructions can be found in the MoodleDocs wiki here: Deployment instructions of the new Moodle adapter (ELM 3.0) NOTE: If you are not using the latest version of Elluminate, the latest Moodle code will continue to work for you. The changes made are backwards-compatible with previous Elluminate versions.

Post title: Elluminate 9.0 compatibility?
Post description: Has anyone installed the Elluminate 9.0 update yet? Are there any known compatibility issues with the Moodle integration module? The reason why I'm asking is that we host our own Moodle (1.9) and Elluminate servers. I upgraded Elluminate from 8.5 to 9.0 per their directions, which were for a standalone system. I made no changes at all to the Moodle side. Since the upgrade, there have been reports of strange things when using Elluminate through Moodle. Last week, Elluminate was throwing authentication failures after the application loaded for anyone coming in through Moodle. Today, I have a report that a faculty member received a pink Moodle error box saying "You must be a moderator to create meetings" when he/she tried to add another Elluminate meeting to a Moodle course. Since we're in our winter break here, I'm not sure if the integration is 100% broken with nobody using it, or if these are random problems. Anyway, I was wondering if we are the first site to do this upgrade, or if somebody else has Elluminate 9.0 successfully integrated which would indicate that I did something wrong when doing the upgrade.....
